Anar and her family have quite a lot of experience in raising animals and growing crops. Monthly income consist of 10,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her farm, Anar turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy a cow for expanding her headcount of livestock.

Anar plans to invest income from the loan in further increasing the quantity of domestic animals, and also the earned income will help to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap is 31 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is also employed in a garment factory. He earns about $8 each day. 

Due to a lack of funds, Sopheap is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase timber and zinc to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to take out another loan to purchase a motorbike for her commute and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase timber and zinc to build a new house

loans.name: Chanra

texts.en:
Chanra is a 33 years old.  She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.  She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animal for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 daily.  Her husband is a construction foreman who makes an income of $7 per day. 

To improve her family’s finances, Chanra is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase construction tools for her husband to use in his business. In addition, a part of this money will be used to buy fertilizer to use for farming. This money will help her husband obtain enough tools to build bigger projects. 

In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools to use in her husband's business.

loans.name: Sreyny

texts.en:
Sreyny is 37 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $15 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $7 daily. 

To improve her family’s finance, Sreyny is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase farmland to use for rice cultivation. This money will help her run an additional business and generate more income for the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for rice cultivation

loans.name: Sayvali

texts.ru: Фармацевт Сайвали до сих пор продолжает работу в аптеке. Два года назад он брал кредит для приобретения антибиотиков, шприцов и других необходимых препаратов. Он выражает всем благодарность за финансовую поддержку в бизнесе. Сайвали ценит свой бизнес, так как он обеспечивает жителей своего района качественными медицинскими препаратами, а свою семью доходом. Сейчас в его аптеке заканчиваются запасы препаратов и ему необходимо пополнить полки разными ассортиментами медикаментов. В связи с этим Сайвали обращается за повторным кредитом в размере 2000 долларов США. На сумму от кредита он собирается закупить разнообразный ассортимент медицинских препаратов. Сайвали надеется, что его снова поддержат в развитии бизнеса.
texts.en: Sayvali, a pharmacist, continues to work in his pharmacy. Two years ago he took out a loan to acquire antibiotics, syringes, and other essential supplies. He expresses his thanks to everyone for the financial support of his business. Sayvali values his business, since he takes care of the residents of his region with quality medical supplies and of his family with the income. Now his pharmacy is running out of inventory and he needs to fill the shelves with various types of medicine. For this reason Sayvali is looking for a second loan of 2,000 USD, with which he will buy a varied assortment of medicines and medical supplies. He hopes for continued support in the development of his business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and supplies for his pharmacy business

loans.name: Mulandi

texts.en:
Mulandi is a married woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Yuly Tatiana

texts.es:
Ella es tatiana, esta estudiando administración hotelera ya que mas adelante ella piensa tener su propio bar.
El convenio le sirve ya que ella puede con esa plata para poder ayudarle a sus padres para seguir con el programa, terminarlo y de hay ella entrara atrabajar en un bar.
A ella le gusta mucho esa parte de cocina y bar, porque quiere desempeñarse en la parte de alimentos y bebidas, después de terminar con esta carrera ella piensa estudiar el área de gastronomía.
Le parece muy interesante estar en la parte de alimentos y bebidas, porque en ocasiones con el profesor que ella estudia le enseño a preparar cócteles y le pareció muy interesante a ella enfocarse en la parte de alimentos y bebidas,aprendió mucho con el profesor cuando les dio una pequeña clase de cocina.
Apuesto mucho en practica lo que ha aprendido ya que ella ha podido ayudar a su familia, con estos tipos de eventos ha podido poner en practica todos los conocimientos que ha adquirido en la institución.
La institución ha sido muy buena, porque brinda muchas posibilidades para estudiar y ser alguien en un futuro.
texts.en:
This is Tatiana.  She is studying hospitality management and, in the future, would like to own her own bar.

This loan will help Tatiana to support her parents so that she may continue with and finish her studies.  After that, she can then start to work in a bar.

Tatiana really likes the kitchen and bar related areas of her studies as it is in the food and drink areas that she would like to work when she finishes her studies.

She finds the food and drinks area of her studies interesting as, on occasions, the teachers have shown Tatiana how to prepare cocktails.  She thinks it would be interesting to work in this area and she has learned a lot from her teacher in cooking classes.

Tatiana has put her education into practise and she has been able to help her family.  Tatiana has been able to apply her knowledge from school in practical terms.

The organisation has been very good as it is offering many opportunities to study and to do some something in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for a semester.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: La Señora Justina sigue con la misma actividad de la confección de ropa como chalecos, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de una máquina,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de tela por mayor  y así seguir mejorando su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Justina continues with the same activity of vest dressmaking. She says her previous loan was very helpful and that she used it to buy a sewing machine. She is now requesting a loan to buy fabric in bulk, which will allow her to improve her business and income.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make vests.

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: Le promoteur s’appelle MODOU, il est célibataire et prend en charge sa mère et ses trois frères . Il évolue dans la confection et la commercialisation de pagnes tissées. MODOU a une expérience de plus de 3ans et sollicite ce montant pour acheter du fils et les accessoires qui entrent  dans la fabrication de pagne tissée. Il commence sa journée  et finit à 15h. Il  habite à quelques kilomètres du Guichet et il est à son 1er prêt. Avec l’aide de l’institution  il souhaite développer son activité et acquérir de nouveaux matériels pour plus de rentabilité.
texts.en:
Modou is an entrepreneur.  He is single and has financial responsibility for his mother and three brothers.  He makes and sells embroidered pagnes (traditional wrap-around clothing).  Modou has more than three years' experience in this business.  He will use his loan to buy thread and the accessories which he needs to make embroidered pagnes.  He finishes his working day at 3pm.  

Modou lives several kilometres away from the field partner, and this will be his first loan with them.

With the help of the field partner, Modou would like to expand his business, and buy new materials to increase his profitability.

loans.use: to buy thread and accessories needed to make embroidered pagnes (traditional wrap-around clothing.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
Meet 51-year-old James, a farmer who hails from Kisii. He is married and has five children. He has been doing farming for 17 years; he produces and sells milk, eggs, tea and bananas. Farming is very important to him as it is his main source of income. Though he gets a lot of produce from the field, he faces a challenge of transporting it to the market because of the poor roads and lack of a good market.

James chose Juhudi Kilimo because they meet the needs of the small farm holders, and their loans are at a low interest rate. This loan is for purchasing a dairy cow, which in turn will bring in more income. This will improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en: Mbodze appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: La Conscience Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Jolie est une Commerçante depuis 7ans, conseillère et membre d’un groupe d’Affaires « La Conscience» âgée de 27 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants qui 1 étudie et trois sont encore gamins. Elle est vendeuse de friperie. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir  pour acheter 1 ballon de friperie. Son conjoint est un technicien maçon. Elle avait reçu son premier  fonds par le biais de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, son capital, scolariser ses enfants, les nourrir et les soigner régulièrement. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Jolie is a member of, and advisor to, the business group 'La Conscience', and has been a seller of second-hand clothing for seven years.  She is 27 years old, married and mother to four children.  One of her children attends school but the other three are too young to attend.

Jolie has requested this loan from the field partner, Hekima, in order to enlarge her business.  This new loan will be used to buy a parcel of second-hand clothing.  Her husband is a stone mason.  He provided the initial money to allow her to go into business.

In the future, she would like to extend her loans, increase her business capital, send her children to school and feed and care for them regularly.

Jolie would like to thank Hekima for the support they offer to women entrepreneurs by extending credit to them without the need for a material guarantee.  This is especially important at this critical moment of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy a parcel of second-hand clothing for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong (pictured here), age 41, lives in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has three daughters; one is married and the other two are garment workers.

Kong buys and sells fish that her husband catches, because her husband is a fisherman. She is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her family to commute.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her family to commute.

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Hean (pictured here) is a weaver. She lives in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has two sons; one attends school and another one is still young. Her husband is a garment worker. In addition, Hean and her husband also grow pumpkins and rice when farming season comes.

Anyway, Hean does not have a motorbike for family transportation. She needs to spend a lot of money for traveling costs. It’s difficult for her to manage on her income. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family transportation.

loans.name: Vichheka

texts.en:
Vichheka (in the photo), age 26, lives in the Phnom Penh suburb. He has been married since 2012 and has a seven-month-old son. 
Vichheka and his wife are garment workers. The couple commutes to work by riding a bicycle.  Riding a bicycle is tiring and time consuming; hence, Vichheka decided to apply for a loan to buy a secondhand motorcycle.  He will also use part of the loan to build a concrete foundation for his house.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and build a concrete foundation for his house.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon is 50 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than three years, earning approximately $6 per day.  Her husband is a chef who makes an income of $10 daily.  Her children are employed in garment factory.  They earn about $12 each day. 

To improve her family’s finance, Thon is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase pigs to breed and resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she will generate more income for the family.

In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to breed and resell when they gain weight

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Bunthoeun live in a village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  He has four sons and one daughter.  Two of them have full-time employment, other two are in school, and the other one is 6 months old.  

Bunthoeun buys nets, blankets, mats, silk, cotton fabric, scarves, and hammocks and resells them in her village.  In addition they also do farming when farming season comes. 

Bunthoeun is applying for a loan to buy a motorcycle for his son's commute to school.   

In this photo Bunthoeun is shown standing next to the items he sells.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his son's commute to school.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok is 34-years-old.  He is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  He has been working in construction for more than three years, earning approximately $6 daily.  His wife (who is joining him in the picture with their son) is a garment worker who makes an income of $7 each day. In addition, this couple are rice farmers. To improve his farming process, Sok asks for a loan of $1,000 to purchase cattle for tilling his farmland.  In the future, he would like to expand his farming business and send his children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for tilling his farmland

loans.name: Tha

texts.en: Tha is 28-years-old. She is married and resides with a three year-old child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) is a construction worker who makes an income of $6 daily.  Due to lack of funds, Tha is requesting a loan of $1,300 to purchase construction materials to build a new house.  This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family.  In the future, she would like to run an additional business to make more money and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara (in the photo), age 28, lives in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. He has two young children.   
   
Sara and his wife are garment workers. He is applying for a loan to help his brother for buying a motorbike. Because he doesn't have his own transportation to get work, he asks his neighbor and drives with them very often.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his brother to drive to work.

loans.name: Sohieng

texts.en:
Sohieng, who sells grocery items from home, lives in a village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has one son and two daughters, all of whom are attending school.

Sohieng's husband is a rice farmer and raises cows at home. Sohieng has requested a loan to buy an additional cow for her husband to raise and more grocery items for her inventory.

loans.use: To buy another cow for her husband to raise and more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Samini

texts.en:
Samini is a married woman with four children; three are adults and one is in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling women's wrap clothes (lessos). She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Samini is requesting 40,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase 40 pieces of women's wrap clothes (lessos) for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase 40 pieces of women's wrap clothes (lessos) for resale

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine operates a vegetable and fruit stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business, and the previous loan helped her to purchase bananas, mangoes, and avocados for her business.
 
With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu at large.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is 28 years old.  He lives with his wife and his two children in Nablus, a city in the northern West Bank approximately 49 kilometers north of Jerusalem, with a population of 126,132.  He works in the painting sector.

Omar asking Ryada for this loan to buy flagstones to pave his floor and to build doors and windows, which will help hiim get ahead because he has a shortage of money to buy the things he needs.  He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to pave his floors and to build doors and windows

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna de 48 años de edad, con un hijo bajo su responsabilidad. Es originario del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de su familia. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. 
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante  tiene por actividad económica el servicio de gimnasio en su casa de habitación. El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su  servicio. El objetivo del crédito es para darles mantenimiento a  los equipos de ejercicios para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Reyna agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Reyna is 48 years old and has a son.  Reyna is originally from Sauce, in the north of Nicaragua, and is hard-working, responsible and has a desire to get ahead.  In her free time, Reyna likes to enjoy the company of her family.

Unfortunately, due to a lack of money, Reyna was not able to study at university and had to work from a young age.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, Reyna now has a gym in her home.  She works ten hours every day.  This loan will be used to maintain the exercise machines in the gym so that, in the not-too-distant future, she can earn a higher income.  Reyna is grateful to Kiva investors for helping poor countries such as Nicaragua and for giving poor people the opportunity to have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to maintain gym equipment.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is married with four children; three are in school and one is underage. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanarusi has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocery in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition to that, she sells foodstuffs to supplement her income. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business, and she appreciates the support of the previous loan.
 
With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Lina Maria

texts.es: Ella es lina maria, estudia servicios farmacéuticos y pasa a segundo semestre, vive con la mama, la hermana y el papa, la mama actualmente no tiene un ingreso fijo, porque su labor es cuidar niños, entonces si llegase a enfermar o tener algún percance quedaría sin ingreso alguno, el padre actualmente trabaja para una oficina de empleos temporal como mensajero de la misma, ganándose solo el mínimo. En la casa no ay mas ingresos, ella no trabaja porque es muy complicado que le den empleo a una menor de edad en algún lugar respetable con un sueldo aceptable, ella necesita la ayuda de kiva puesto que estaba pagando una mensualidad medio cómoda y ahora como subió el valor de la mensualidad le resulta un poco difícil pagarla, puesto que es casi el doble, a demás de esto ella termina el bachillerato el año próximo y se viene los gastos para el grado y es por eso es que a ella le servirá mucho el descuento que kiva ofrece para aquellos que perdieron sus beneficios por distintas entidades, porque aunque el descuento no es igual al que tenia antes si rebaja en algo la mensualidad en las cuotas a pagar a campo alto, porque ella realmente quiere hacer el esfuerzo para seguir estudiando porque sabe que teniendo esto tiene una oportunidad de trabajo y con ella puede garantizar pagar su universidad y tener un buen futuro para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Lina María's starting her second semester of pharmaceutical services.  She lives with her mother, father, and brother.

Lina María's mother currently doesn't have a fixed income because she works in child care and doesn't get paid if she gets sick or suffers some setback.  Her father earns minimum wage working as a messenger for a temporary job agency.  This is the only household income.  Lina María doesn't work because it's difficult for a minor to earn an acceptable wage in a respectable place.

Lina María needs help from Kiva because she was making a fairly affordable monthly payment but the amount almost doubled so it's difficult for her to pay it.  Also, she's finishing her degree next year and will have to pay the graduation fees.  This is why it will help her a lot to have the discount that Kiva offers to those who have lost their benefits from other organizations.  Even though the discount isn't the same as the one she had before, it does lower somewhat her monthly payment to CampoAlto.

Lina María very much wants to make the effort to continue studying because she knows it will lead to job opportunities.  As a result she'll be able to repay her university and have a good future for herself and her family.

loans.use: to pay her tuition for the semester

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg (E) Group

texts.en:
Pramila is a 45-year-old lady, currently engaged in vegetable cultivation and vegetable selling. She cultivates and sells vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes, ladyfingers (okra), bitter gourds, bottle gourds, cabbage etc. From this activity, she is able to make 3,000 INR per month. Along with twelve  other women from her village, she created a Self Help group called "Maa Mangala SHG", and Pramila is the president of this group. In the picture, the lady seated third from the right is Pramila. The group is made up of members having a purpose to help and support each other in their business activities and in their personal lives. All the group members are engaged in different activities to make some money for their household expenses.

Pramila lives with her parents-in-law, husband and her three children who are in school. Her husband is a farmer who is engaged in paddy cultivation; sometimes he helps in Pramila's business activity. Pramila and her husband both take on all the family's responsibilities. Pramila has a dream of making a house for her family and educating her children. 

Pramila, along with her group members, has requested a loan of 195,000 INR. Pramila will use her portion to purchase standard quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable cultivation. She is really very thankful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase standard quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable cultivation.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in the Nanyuki area together with her family. She is 38 years old and married with two children who attend school. She has been practicing farming for the last 15 years, and the business has really grown. She has several casual laborers she employees when she has a lot of work in the farm. 

She knew about Milango through friends who asked her to join them so that they can save and be able to access funding for their businesses. She now seeks a loan to buy fertilizer, farm chemicals and dairy meal. The challenge that she faces in the business is a lack of a good market for her farm produce and unfavorable weather conditions at times. The income that she will raise from the business will improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, farm chemicals and dairy meal

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married and has two school-going children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a green grocery business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high competition from other green grocers. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Saba Gull's Group

texts.en:
Saba Gull is the age of 35, living with her husband.

Her husband owns an electrical shop, in which he sells light bulbs, troubleshoots bulbs and provides light decoration services for weddings, birthdays and engagement ceremonies.  

He stores his bulbs in card board boxes.  A few days ago his boxes fell down from a shelf and most of the light bulbs have broken.  Now he does not have sufficient bulbs in stock to sell and does not have decoration lights to provide services. Therefore, Saba Gull requested a loan for her husband so he can buy new light bulbs to sell and for decoration lights to provide the decoration services. 

Saba Gull thanks to kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy light bulbs for resale and for decorative lighting for parties.

loans.name: Jorge Enrique

texts.es:
Jorge Enrique, siendo  una persona honesta, tolerante, responsable que se ha esforzado en realizar las actividades que se ha propuesto a realizar. Actualmente a ingresado en el grado 11 º y quien ha finalizo el primer semestre de Ensamble, Reparación y Mantenimiento de Hardware de  Campo Alto. 
Quien desde pequeño se ha resaltado por tener curiosidad del funcionamiento mecánico y eléctrico de el implemento inventado por el hombre. 
Una de las grandes razones para estudiar en Campo alto se debe a que  Adriana  estudio la carrera de Auxiliar de Enfermería donde fue una de las primeras egresadas de ACESALUD en el año  2001 quien es la madre de Jorge enrique y teniendo en cuenta la gran eficacia y el gran desempeño que tiene campo alto  frente al ámbito laboral y desarrollo de competencias laborales. 

Con los conocimientos actuales y el desarrollo que existe en el mundo ha desarrollado un gusto hacia el tema de ensamble y mantenimiento, puesto que los componentes internos de una computadora adicionando los diferentes sistemas operativos existentes en la actualidad que permite que siendo un grupo de elementos que dan una gran funcionalidad.
Adicional otra de las razones por lo que se selecciono la carrera de ensamble y mantenimiento es debido a que Cristhian hermano  de Jorge Enrique trabaja con tecnología y es quien genera una imagen y motivación de continuar con esta.
Por otra parte es una excelente carrera para dar un inicio a la vida laboral y profesional que permite laborar en diferentes tipos de empleo.
Ya que jorge enrique pertenecía al convenio de jóvenes en acción quienes cancelaban un valor mas económico semestral, pero como el valor de el semestre se incremento   en el momento la familia  no puede hacerse cargo de cancelar este monto dando como resultado el retiro de la carrera por falta de recursos, por eso el necesitaría la ayuda de kiva para poder terminar sus estudios con facilidad de pago.
texts.en:
Jorge Enrique is an honest, tolerant, and responsible person who has endeavored to carry out the activities he proposes to perform. He is currently enrolled in the 11th grade and has ended the first semester of Assembly, Repair, and Maintenance of Computer Hardware with CampoAlto. 
Since his childhood, he has been curious about mechanical and electrical operations invented by humankind. 
On of the great reasons to study in CampoAlto for Jorge Enrique is due to his mother, Adriana, who studied to be a nursing assistant as one of the first graduates of ACESALUD in 2001. Jose Enrique took into account the great efficiency and achievement that CampoAlto has at the forefront in the area of industry and the development of work competency.
With the current knowledge and development that exists in the world, Jorge Enrique has developed a liking of the subject of assembly and maintenance since adding different operating systems to the internal components of a computer provides great functionality. 
Another additional reason to have a career in assembly and maintenance is that Jorge Enrique's brother, Cristhian, is working with technology and gives Jorge Enrique the inspiration and motivation to pursue this career.
It is an excellent career for his entry into the field that will allow him to work in different types of jobs.
Jorge Enrique belongs to a group of young people who currently pay a budget tuition for the semester, however, the tuition for next semester has increased and his family can not cover the extra amount because of their lack of resources, therefore, he needs a Kiva loan to ease his tuition payment and finish his studies.

loans.use: to pay a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Elizabeth Cristina, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera. Ella forma parte del grupo "Nuevo Amanecer" que está formado por seis socios, todos ellos trabajadores, tiene su pequeño negocio, han demostrado hasta la fecha ser personas responsables, puntuales en sus pagos.
Elizabeth Cristina, se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace aproximadamente ocho años, inició este negocio como apoyo, luego de aprender el negocio y al ver que le gustaba y le rendiría ganancias decidió iniciar su propio negocio, su puesto de comida está ubicado en un mercado de su zona. poco a poco ha ido creciendo, actualmente tiene clientela fija, ya que reconocen que tiene buena sazón así que los clientes la recomiendan.
Elizabeth Cristina, invertirá el préstamo recibido en la compra de insumos para la preparación de los alimentos, así como también renovará parte de su menaje.
texts.en:
Elizabeth Cristina is 23 years old and single. She is a member of “Nuevo Amanecer”, which is composed of six members. All of them work and have their own business. They have proven so far that they are responsible persons and that they pay their dues on time.

Elizabeth Cristina has been selling food for approximately eight years. She started to do so occasionally, but when she realized that she liked it and that it was leaving her good profits, she decided to start a business. Her stall is located at a local marketplace. Her business has grown with time and she has now fixed customers that like the taste of her food and recommend her to others.

Elizabeth Cristina will use the loan to buy ingredients to prepare food and to renovate part of her equipment.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food and renovate part of her equipment.

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es:
Mario es un joven soltero, de 19 años de edad, quien vive junto a sus padres, en el Departamento de Sololá. 
Actualmente se dedica al cultivo de papa y otras hortalizas a unos metros de su vivienda. A través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias que le ayudan a contribuir a la economía de su familia. Cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en este trabajo. Eligió esta actividad porque para él es un trabajo honrado y rentable. Al momento de cosechar su cultivo lo comercializa en el mercado local de Sololá. 
Ahora el está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,500.00 para la compra de insumos agrícolas para el mantenimiento de su cultivo ya que en esta época del año la demanda de estos cultivos aumenta.
Sus dos sueños más grandes son introducir tecnología en la agricultura que realiza y por otro lado construir una casa propia en donde pueda formar una familia.
texts.en:
Mario, 19, is a single young man who lives with his parents in the department of Sololá.  Currently he makes a living growing potatoes and other vegetables a few meters from his house.  The income and profits he earns from this help him contribute to his family's finances.

Mario has five years of experience in this job.  He chose it because it's honorable and profitable work.  When it's time to harvest his crop he sells it in the local market in Sololá.

Currently Mario's requesting a loan for 4,500 quetzales [GTQ] to buy agricultural inputs to take care of his crop because demand increases this time of year.

His two biggest dreams are to introduce technology into his farming and build his own house where he can have a family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Israel

texts.en:
Israel is a 25-year-old farmer living in Kisii, where he has been doing farming for six years. He is married and has two children. He produces and sells milk, eggs, tea and crops like bananas, which do very well in the area. He loves farming because it has very good returns, depending on a person's hard work, and it is also his source of income. His main challenge would be when he is transporting his produce because of the poor roads and lack of well-established market.

Israel said that he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they give out their loans at a low interest rate, and they also meet the needs of small farm holders. This loan will help him construct a dairy unit in order to create a good environment for his dairy cows to produce more. This will help him provide better education for his children, and also improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Jacob's Group

texts.en:
Jacob’s group has six group-leader farmers and is located in Webuye District. The group leaders in this group represent a total of 54 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 shillings to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. As the Kiva group representative, Jacob is pictured on the right of the Bidii Group with his hand raised.

Jacob is married and has six children. He is 42 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer. He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee. Jacob has been a farmer for 18 years. Jacob described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Jacob first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Jacob joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, new farming methods, fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and to earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member, wants to help more farmers and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Jacob plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, repair the home, buy a goat and invest in a business. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Jacob’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest, more farm training, more farm group support, and was able to save money and feed the family.  
							
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Jacob and the Bidii Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Sunguchini Group

texts.en:
Asha is a widow aged mid-40s. She is raising a family of three children, one son and two daughters, who are in school. For six years now, she has been providing for her family by engaging in two businesses: a beauty salon and a catering business where she receives food cooking orders for different functions. Asha starts working at 9 am and is busy till 10 pm every work day and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This is her eleventh loan from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. Asha used her previous loans to open another beauty salon branch in Zanzibar and bought catered food serving dishes and food stocks. She is really doing great and her businesses really grow day after day. She has managed to pay back all her previous loans successfully. 

Asha used her profit to cover school fees and household expenses and reinvested in her businesses. She will use this loan to buy salon equipment. She dreams of building a nice family house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Sunguchini" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Sunny

texts.en:
Sunny (in the photo) lives in a village about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  She has been married since 2008 and has two young daughters. 

Sunny and her husband are farmers.  They grow corn on their farmland in the village where they live.  Sunny’s husband is also a motor taxi driver when he is not at the farm.  

Sunny wants to maintain her farm by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide, Sunny decided to apply for a loan of $1,500.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en:
Samorn (in the photo), age 27, lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. She has been married since 2008 and has one young son.

Samorn is hired to farm and gets paid a fee, while her husband is a lathe operator. She wants to earn extra income with a new business  selling sugarcane juice. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan to buy a sugarcane juicing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sugarcane juicing machine.

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.es: Marina de 43 años de edad posee una tienda desde hace 20 años esta ubicada en su lugar de habitación, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar alguno gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con sus dos padres, Marina esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder surtir su tienda y así obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con sus padres.
texts.en: Marina is 43 years old and has owned her own shop for 20 years.  She runs the shop out of her own home and she has many customers due to the variety of products on offer, and the good prices. Marina is able to use her profits to cover some household costs. Marina lives in her own house with her parents. Marina is applying for a loan in order to buy more products in bulk so as to stock up her store.  With more products, Marina can earn higher profits and can enjoy a higher quality of live alongside her parents.

loans.use: to buy beans, oil, sugar, coffee, sweets, soft drinks and more.

loans.name: Salvador Humberto

texts.es: Don salvador de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, es responsable y trabajador, se dedica a la mecanica de obra de banco( elaboracion de estructuras metalicas: puertas, balcones, portones, techos) desde hace varios años, Don Salvador solicita el credito para comprar mas materiales como hierro, metal, lamina, etc. ya que tiene mucha demanda porque hace un buen trabajo y con las ganancias que obtiene ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y solventar los gastos que se le presentan.
texts.en: Salvador is 51 years old and lives in his own home with his family - his wife and four children.  Salvador is responsible and hard-working.  He has been working as a metalworker (producing metal structures such as doors, balconies, garage doors and roofs) for a number of years. Salvador is applying for this loan in order to buy more material such as iron, metals, laminate sheeting and more as demand is high due to his good work.  Salvador has been able to use his profits to help the family to get ahead and to cover household costs.

loans.use: to buy more material such as iron, metals, laminate sheeting and more.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the kids.

For the past three years, she has operated a shoe selling business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of work. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Nanyuki  in the central province of Kenya. She is 22 years old and she is married. For the last three years she has been running a boutique and a salon. She also practices farming that gives her extra income. She employs casual laborers in her farm when she has a lot of work, especially during the planting and harvesting seasons. She learned about Milango through friends who asked her to join them so that they could save and be able to access funding for their businesses. 

Grace now seeks a loan to buy new clothes for sale. She will also use part of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. The challenges that she faces in business are competition for customers and unfavorable weather conditions at times. The income that she will raise will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for sale

loans.name: Hendritta

texts.en:
Hendritta is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

She operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
71-year-old Gerald is happy that he was able to get a Kiva loan that he has repaid without much difficulty.  His farming business has improved and right now he wants to take his cereal business to the next level. 

He seeks a loan to buy cereal as additional stock for his business.  He hopes that the business will grow into wholesale in the next five years.  The challenge that he faces is the competition from other traders, which he feels is healthy for his business. 

The extra income the he will raise from the business will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cereals to increase his stock

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past  several years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbours and she dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking  oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Marly Andreina

texts.es:
Marly está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder realizar mejoras en el pequeño cuarto donde vive, con lo cual mejorar su calidad de vida.

Actualmente Mary se dedica a su trabajo como empleada en una pequeña institución de ciudad con lo cual puede tener ingresos para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marly is very thankful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, she will be able to buy construction materials to carry out repairs on the small room where she lives, which will improve her quality of life.

Currently, Marly is working as an employee in a small institution in the city, which allows her to earn an income in order to get on in life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Christian Alexander

texts.es:
Christian tiene 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de chincha; trabaja como operario en un pequeña empresa de su ciudad.

Christian está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Christian is 21 years old. He lives in the city of Chincha. He works as an operator in a small company in his city.

Christian is thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to buy materials to make improvements to his house and thus improve his quality of life and keep fighting to be able to make his great dream a reality: finish building his house with quality materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Makam

texts.fr:
Monsieur Makam, âgé de la soixantaine, évolue dans le secteur de l’élevage de bœufs. Il a longtemps démarré l’activité d’embouche avec deux vaches qui se sont reproduits petit à petit. Il sollicite un crédit pour acheter trois bœufs et renforcer son cheptel.
Makam est le chef d’une grande famille musulmane avec deux épouses et beaucoup d’enfants qui sont tous à sa charge. Parmi ceux qui sont plus âgés il y en a qui se débrouillent pour appuyer à la dépense quotidienne sinon à part cela, il est tenue de tous les nourrir. Son activité l’aide donc à surmonter ce poids et s’il avait la possibilité de la diversifier, il le fera.
texts.en:
Mr. Makam, in his 60s, works raising cattle. He has started this business long time ago by buying two cows and growing his livestock little by little. He is seeking to buy three bulls and enlarge his herd.

Makam is the head of a large Muslim family. He has two wives and many children, all his dependents. Some of his older children are able to contribute to the household expenses; apart from that, it is up to him to provide for everyone. This business allows him to manage this responsibility. Given the chance to diversify his business, he would do it.

loans.use: to buy three bulls for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Tuinuke Group

texts.en:
Tuinuke A is a Nuru International group of two farmers based within the Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture. The person raising his hand is Francis. He is 35 years old and married with five children who attend school. Francis has been a member of the group for three years, and he is the group’s chairperson.

Francis has been learning better farming methods within his group and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on his farm to grow maize, sorghum, and millet during the 2014 long-rains season. However, he faces financial constraints, so he hopes to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable him purchase the farm inputs. He believe that the use of farm inputs will increase his yields, allowing him to provide enough food for his family as well to have a surplus to sell in order to obtain money to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Nyangoto Group

texts.en:
Nyangoto is a Nuru International group of farmers in the Kuria West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge about improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan.

Jackson, pictured with his hand raised, is a representative of the group. He is 32 years old and married with six children. He has been a member of this group for three years now. 

The loan from KIVA will enable Jackson to obtain hybrid seeds and fertilizer, which he believes will increase his farm yields in this coming season. Like other members of his group, he will take input loans for one acre of land. He will plant a half-acre of maize and a quarter-acre each of sorghum and millet. He will produce food for his household as well as selling the surplus to invest in another business. Thereafter, he hopes to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Kubweye Group

texts.en:
Kubweye is a Nuru International group of three farmers in the Kuria West district in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. As a group, the members of Kubweye collectively guarantee the loan.

Nkiria, who is raising her hand in the picture, is the chairperson of the group and has been a member of the group since 2010. She is 42 years old and is married with five children who go to school. The loan from Kiva will help her acquire the farm inputs she needs in order to obtain high yields. 

Nkiria, just like other members of her group, will take input loans for one acre. she will grow maize in 1/2 acre, and sorghum and millet in a ¼ acre each. She plans to sell the surplus and pay school fees for her children. She also plans to join a savings scheme to save some of the money obtained from selling the surplus. This will give her more financial independence as well as help her absorb financial shocks in the future.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Upendo A Group

texts.en:
This group is a Nuru International group of three farmers called Upendo A. They came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Nyamohanga, who is lifting up his hand, is 45 years old and is married with five children who all go to school. He has been a member of the group for two years now.

With this loan, Nyamohanga envisions to acquire farm inputs for growing ½ acre of maize and ¼ each of sorghum and millet. He hopes this will result in him having a good harvest that will ensure food security for his household and he will also sell the surplus and spend the money in paying school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Kenyanja Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of three farmers called Kenyanja and is based in Kuria West District. They come together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

John, who is raising his hand, has been a member of this group for two years now. He is married and has twelve children. Having a large number of dependents, John is keen to ensure he gets a good harvest that will sustain his family with food. He has learnt a lot of knowledge on better farming methods. However, he is constrained financially in acquiring farm inputs. It is for this reason that John is requesting a loan to enable him to obtain farm inputs.

With the loan, John will obtain farm inputs and he is hopeful that he will get a bountiful harvest that will provide his entire household with food.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a sus familiares en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica a la elaboración de dulces tradicionales de la Zaña, comercio de los mismos, agricultura y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores cerdos, pavos y patos en la parte posterior a su domicilio que luego de engordarlos los ofrece en el mercado de la zona, también cultiva hortalizas y verduras.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cuyes y patos y una segunda parte para la compra de alimentos balanceados y de esta manera tenr una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 35 years old. He lives alongside his family members in the district of Zaña. Its population is dedicated to making and selling traditional sweets from Zaña, farming and raising livestock. It's two hours to the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Peru.

He is dedicated to raising and selling young animals like pigs, turkeys, and ducks in the area behind his house. He fattens them and sells them in his area's market. He also grows vegetables.

He has requested a loan of 1000 PEN to buy guinea pigs and ducks and a second part to buy balanced feed and thus have better production to sell to his customers, generating greater income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy young animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita is from a remote region Maynaguri in the district Jalpaigur . She is married and is a housewife.  She is blessed with one son. She attended school up to class IV (Grade 4). Her husband, Radheshyam, is 48 years old.  He has a shop of hardware products (building materials and supplies) in the locality. Their son receives education. They have a pacca house (brick-built).

Sunita's husband has been running this shop since five years. He sells hardware materials like iron rods, cement, screws, sandpaper, nails, etc. He has chosen this business as there is no other hardware shop in their locality.  The demands of these materials are increasing.  He needs capital to maintain adequate stock of hardware materials for his shop.

Sunita has decided to help her husband by taking a loan and applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partners) to purchase hardware materials.  She hopes the loan will definitely expand the business and the profit as well and improve their family's quality of life.

Her dream is to upgrade their financial condition to give a better future to her son.
 
Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for giving her the loan.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the hardware business.

loans.name: Santona

texts.en:
Santona lives in a remote region of West Bengal.  She lives in the small town of Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She is a 24 -year-old married woman.  Her husband is 35 years old. Santona received education up to class VI (Grade 6), whereas her husband completed primary education from their village school.  They live with their only son in their own small kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo made).  Their son goes to school.

Both Santana and her husband together have an animal husbandry. They buy and rear goats and sell them to the butchers in the local market. Goat meat has a good demand in the market.

She decided to buy a cow to start a milk selling business in the locality for additional income.

Santona came to know that Kiva’s partner BJS gives loans to rural women for starting new businesses, so she applied for a loan to buy a cow. Milk has great demand in their locality, so she hopes to earn great profits from this business.

This business will boost her income source and enable her to cater to her family's needs.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a business of selling milk in the locality.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has six children, five of whom attend school and one is an adult. For the past four years, she has operated a mobile charging business. Power failures are her major challenge. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan from Yehu for 10,000 KES, which she will use to purchase power extensions and mobile chargers. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase power extensions and mobile chargers.

loans.name: Ntaburo Nuru Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of seven farmers called Ntaburo in the Kuria West District of Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge of improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru in order to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members of Ntaburo group collectively guarantee the loan.

Simon, raising his hand in the picture, is the leader of the group. He is 29 years old and has been farming for about 25 years. He is married with four children. He has been a member of this group for three years now. The loan from KIVA will help him acquire farm inputs which should increase his production of maize, sorghum and millet. 

Simon hopes to obtain enough food for his family and then sell the surplus and invest the money from the sales in a business. He hopes to use his business profits to pay school fees for his four children.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Nyanduruma A Group

texts.en:
This group is a Nuru International group of eight farmers called Nyanduruma A in the Kuria West district of Kenya. They come together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Wankuru who is holding up his hand is 30 years old and is married with eight children who all go to school. He has been a member of the group for two years now.

With his loan, Wankuru plans to acquire farm inputs to grow ½ acre of maize and ¼ each of sorghum and millet. He hopes this will result in him having a good harvest which will ensure food security for his household and then he would also sell the surplus and use the money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Migingo B Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of four farmers called Migingo B. They came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Michael, who has his hand up, is 43 years old and married with five children. He has been a member of the group for the past two years.

With this loan, Michael plans to acquire hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow ½ acre of maize and ¼ acre each of sorghum and millet. He hopes this will result in him having a good harvest, which would ensure food security for his family. Then he would sell the surplus and use the money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Gwikonge B Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of four farmers called Gwikonge B and based in Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Truphena, who is a member of this group for the second year now, believes she will continue to reap good benefits by joining the group. Being someone who has depended on subsistence agriculture, Truphena believes that this will change when she uses hybrid seeds and fertilizers. She is married with three children who go to school.

Truphena hopes to obtain a loan to purchase farm inputs. With the use of the farm inputs, she believes she will get a good enough harvest for food in her household as well as to sell the surplus to pay school fees for her eight children who go to school.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Canaan Group

texts.en:
Canaan is a Nuru International group of five farmers in the Kuria West District of Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan.
Elizabeth, who is raising up her hand, is the chairperson of the group and has been a member since 2010. She is 38 years old and married with three children who go to school. The loan from Kiva will enable her to acquire hybrid seeds and fertilizer which will result in high yields. Elizabeth, just like other members of her group, will take input loans for one acre. She will grow maize on a half acre and sorghum and millet on a quarter acre each. She plans to sell the surplus and pay school fees for her children. She also will join a plan to save some of the money obtained from selling the surplus. This will give her more financial independence.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Nyangoto B Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of farmers called Nyangoto B and is based within the Kuria West District of Kenya. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.
The person raising up her hand in the picture is Mohono.  She is 36 years old and married with four children.  Mohono has joined this group for the first time and hopes the production on her farm will go up due to the extension services she is going to receive through this group.  She is very excited about the 2014 long rains.
Mohono has been learning better farming methods within her group and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on her farm to grow maize, sorghum and millet during the 2014 long rains seasons.  She is, however, constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable her to purchase these farm inputs. She believes that the use of hybrid seeds and fertilizer will increase her yields and she will not only get enough food for her family but will also sell the surplus and obtain money to invest in dairy cattle.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Pamoja Group

texts.en:
Pamoja is a Nuru International group of farmers in Kuria, West District, in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan.

Pius, pictured with the hand raised up, is a representative of the group of Nuru Farmers. Pius is 18 years old and married with one child. Pius has been farming with Nuru for two years. The loan for Kiva in this coming season will enable him to obtain hybrid seeds and fertilizer, which he believes will increase his farm yields. 

Pius, just like other members of his group, will take input loans for 1 acre. He will grow maize on 1/2 an acre, and sorghum and millet on ¼ acre each. He will obtain food for his household as well as sell the surplus, and will invest in another business thereafter to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Jiinue Group

texts.en:
Jiinue is a Nuru International group of six farmers in Kuria West District in Kenya that Nuru works with. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improving farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group the members collectively guarantee the loan.

Antony is the leader of the group. He is 35-years-old and has been farming for about 10 years. He is married with six children. He has been a member of this group for three years now. The loan from KIVA will enable him to acquire hybrid seeds and fertilizer which should increase his production of maize, sorghum and millet. Antony hopes to obtain enough food for his family, sell the surplus and invest the money from the sales in a business which will later generate profits that will be used to pay school fees for his six children.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Ingubo Group

texts.en:
This group is a Nuru International group of seven farmers called Ingubo, based within Kuria West district. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Joseph, who is raising his hand, has been a member of this group for three years. He is 26 years old and married with three children.

With the loan from Kiva, Joseph plans to buy farm inputs to grow maize, sorghum, and millet on a one acre farm. The harvest, which he hopes will be very good, will provide food security for his household. He plans to sell the surplus and invest the money in a business to increase the family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet.

loans.name: Mwangaza A Group

texts.en:
This is the Nuru International group of three farmers called Mwangaza A.  It is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

The person raising his hand in the picture is Daniel. He is 29 years old and married, with four children. Daniel has been a member of the group for two years, and he is the group’s chairperson.

He has been learning better farming methods within his group and now desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on his farm to grow maize, sorghum, and millet during the 2014 long rainy seasons.  He is, however, constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable him purchase these farm inputs. 

He believes that the use of hybrid seeds and fertilizer will increase his yields, and he will not only get enough food for his family but will also sell the surplus and obtain money to purchase a dairy cow that will produce milk for sale.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Kilimo Group B

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of two farmers called Kilimo Group B in Nyambotane, based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

The person raising up his hand is Robert. He is 63 years old and married with 10 children who attend school. Robert has been a member of the group for two years, and he is the group’s chairperson. Having a large family, it is prudent for Robert to succeed in agriculture, which is his main source of livelihood.

Robert has been learning better farming methods within his group and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on his farm to grow maize, sorghum and millet during the 2014 long rains seasons. He is, however, constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable him to purchase these farm inputs. He believes that the use of hybrid seeds and fertilizer will increase his yields, and he will not only get enough food for his family, but will also sell the surplus and obtain money to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Mwangaza B Group

texts.en:
Mwangaza B is a group of four farmers supported by Nuru International in Kuria West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge to improve farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs.  As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan.

Joseph (pictured with his hand raised) is a representative of the group. He is a 27-year-old married man with three children, two are going to school. He has been a member of this group for three years. 

The loan for KIVA will enable him to obtain hybrid seeds and fertilizer which he believes will increase his farm yields. Joseph, like the other members of his group, will take input loans for one acre. He will grow maize in 1/2 acre and sorghum and millet in a ¼ acre each. He will grow food for his household as well as sell the surplus. He plans to  invest in another business to diversify the income base for his family.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Gwikonge South Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of six farmers called Gwikonge South and is based within the district Kuria West. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Mary, who has been a member of this group for two years, believes she will continue to reap good benefits from having joined the group. Being someone who has depended on subsistence agriculture, Mary believes that this will change when she uses hybrid seeds and fertilizers. She is married with three children who go to school.

Mary hopes to obtain a loan to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer. With the use of these farm inputs, she believes she will reap enough of a harvest to provide food for her household as well as surplus to sell. This will help her to pay the school fees for her children who go to school.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Nyamongo Group

texts.en:
Nyamongo is a nuru International group of six farmers in Kuria West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members of Nyamongo collectively guarantee the loan.
Samuel who is raising up his hand is a member group and has joined the group for the first time. He was influenced to join this group after he saw his neighbours reaping good benefits from it. He is a 20 year old single man.
The loan from KIVA will enable him to acquire hybrid seeds and fertilizer which will enable him obtain high yields. Samuel just like other members of his group will take input loans for one acre. He will grow maize in 1/2 acre, sorghum and millet in a ¼ acre each. He plans to sell the surplus and obtain money to pay for his college fees next year in September. He wants to train to be a mechanic.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Pilika Pilika Group

texts.en:
Patric, who is in his early 30s, is married with two children. One of his children goes to school and the other one is still small. He has been running a welding business where he makes metal things like gates, burglar proofs and beds. He also has a hardware shop. He has been in this business for eight years now. He works from 8am to 5pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a pipe and an advanced welding machine. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profits to pay for school fees and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy welding pipes, hardware, and to make metal beds.

He dreams of making his hardware shop big.

Patric will share this loan with his loan group "Pilika", and the three members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy welding pipes, hardware stock and to make metal beds.

loans.name: Damy

texts.en:
Damy (in the photo) is 43 years old and lives on an island in the Mekong River. He has been married since 2000 and has one son who attends school. His wife sells fast food and Chinese noodle with soup in the village where they live. 

Damy sells mangoes. He buys mangoes from his fellow villagers under contract, from the blooming season till the harvesting season comes. This means that he pays money before the harvesting season and then he collects the mangoes to sell.  He needs to use pesticide to prevent the mangoes from insect damage.

Hence Damy has asked for a loan to purchase more mangoes under contract for resale and buy pesticide to prevent mangoes from insect damage.

loans.use: to purchase more mangoes under contract for resale and buy pesticide to prevent mangoes from insect damage.

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKELEMA  sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques au quartier KOKO un des quartiers périphérique  de la ville de KADIOLO. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  KOROTOUMOU  fait la vente des condiments dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est la deuxième personne position débout de la  gauche  vers la droite sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  20 paniers de tomates, 20 paquets de cube maggi. Elle vend ses articles au grand marché et à la maison. Elle vend au comptant à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’homme. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The members of the group Benkelema are married women who are on average 30 years old, and have on average 3 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in the Koko neighborhood, one of the outlying neighborhoods of the town of Kadiolo.

They are on their eleventh loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, out of the concern to meet the needs of their clientele.

Madam Korotoumou sells condiments as part of this group of women. She is the person in the second position standing from left to right in the photo.

With her loan she plans to buy 20 baskets of tomatoes and 20 packages of maggi cubes. She sells her items at the large market and from home. She sells for cash to a clientele made up of women and men.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA of which part is used to repay the loan and its interest and the other part is saved.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  SOUTOURA  sont essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques au quartier KOKO un des quartiers périphérique  de la ville de KADIOLO  cercle de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  ROKIA  fait la vente des condiments dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est la troisième  personne position débout de la  gauche  vers la  droite sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  10 paniers de tomates, 10 paquets de cube maggi. Elle vend ses articles au grand marché et à la maison. Elle vend au comptant à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’homme. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The members of the group Soutoura are mainly married women who are on average 33 years old, and have on average 4 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in the Koko neighborhood one of the outlying neighborhoods of the town of Kadiolo, Sikasso cercle.

They are on their fifth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, out of the concern to meet the needs of their clientele.

Madam Rokia sells condiments as part of this group of women. She is the third person in standing position from left to right in the photo.

With her loan she plans to buy 10 baskets of tomatoes and 10 packages of maggi cubes. She sells her items at the large market and from home. She sells for cash to a clientele made up of women and men.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA of which part is used to repay the loan and its interest and the other part is saved.
