loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es:
María de 56 años de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos, es originaria del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país.  El  sauce se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche, crema, queso. Es una mujer emprendedora., trabajadora, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde muy joven.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de Lena en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en la compra de leña, para ofrecer a sus clientes y en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  María agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María, age 56, is a single mother with two children.  She is from Sauce, which is located in the northern part of the country.  Sauce is known for being an area that produces milk, cream and cheese.  She is an industrious, hardworking woman, with a desire to improve herself.  In her free moments, she likes to enjoy the company of her children.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, she couldn’t study to become a professional.  She had to work from a very young age.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, she has a business selling firewood in her home.  She spends eight hours a day at her work, offering her goods.  The goal of this loan is to invest in the purchase of firewood to offer to her customers, so that in the not-so-distant future she can earn a better income.

María expresses her thanks for the help to get a decent job that Kiva investors give to people with few resources and to poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy firewood to offer to her customers

loans.name: Sara Olimpia

texts.es: Sara de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee un panadería en su lugar de habitación donde elabora pan francés y pan dulce dese hace varios años, el cual también sale a comercializarlo a las diferentes colonias donde ella reside, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo quien trabaja como albañil y le ayuda en la panadería logran solventar algunos gastos que se les presentan en su hogar, Sara esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, manteca, latas, etc. para poder seguir elaborando el pan y asi obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sara is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  Sara has a bread shop in her house, where she has been making rolls and sweet breads for a number of years.  Sara also goes out to sell her bread in the different areas around her home. Sara's husband helps her in the bakery and also works as a builder.  With their combined earnings, they are able to cover some household costs.  Sara is applying for a loan in order to buy flour, butter, dough and more in order to continue making bread and earn higher profits. She can then give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, and dough.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 24 years old. He lives at the family house in Deir al-Ghusun. Deir al-Ghusun is a Palestinian town in the Tulkarm Governorate, located eight kilometers northeast of the city of Tulkarm in the northern West Bank. The town is near the Green Line. The town had a population of 8,242 in 2007. 

He works in the public sector. His dream is to fund his marriage and repair a house to live there.

Ahmad's family lacks the money to do some work on the house, so he applied to Ryada for a loan to repair the ceiling to prevent the rain water from flowing in. This will improve the house and make it better, and he also wants to install windows and doors.
 
Ahmad said that this loan will help him a lot and he is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to repair the ceiling and install windows and doors.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a married 34-years-old Iraqi client who has two children and owns a small shop for selling mobile phones and their accessories. He offers to sell mobile phones with affordable and competitive prices and he provides all the needed mobile phone accessories for his clients. 

He established his business in 2007. He is gradually gaining experience through his practice and he is gaining a good reputation in the neighborhood. 

Ahmad is requesting a loan of $3,000 to pay the annual rent of his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his revenues so that he may provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop.

loans.name: Jeomar Elisa

texts.es:
Jeomar de 27 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad. Es originaria del  Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Ella se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos  económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos de hogar.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de granos básicos,  el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra y venta de granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, frijoles, detergente, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Jeomar agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Jeomar is 27 years old, married and has two children, both under 18.  Jeomar is originally from Sauce, in the north of Nicaragua.  She is hard-working, responsible and has a desire to get ahead. Unfortunately due to a lack of money, Jeomar was not able to study at university and had to work from a young age in order to help with household bills.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, Jeomar works selling staple goods.  She runs the business out of her home and works selling her products for twelve hours every day. This loan will be used to invest in working capital by buying staple goods such as a rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, detergent and matches.  This will allow Jeomar to earn a higher income in the not-too-distant future.  

Jeomar is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping poor countries such as Nicaragua, and for providing poor people with opportunities to have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock up her business by buying staple goods such as a rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, detergent and matches.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is happy that she was able to get a loan from Kiva and she is happy that her business improved. She repaid the loan without challenges and she is grateful. She now seeks another loan to buy second-hand clothes for the business. She hopes that in the next five years she will be operating a wholesale business.  The major challenges that she faces in the business include the seasonal market and competition from other traders. The income that she will make will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Hameeda is the age of 50, living with her three children and husband in Lahore City, where most Indian families are living. The town is very populated and mostly crowded with people who belong to India. 

Most people like to chew betel leaf, so a few months ago, Hameeda's son decided to open a betel leaf shop to offer different kinds of betel leaf to the people. He acts upon the strategy and got a shop to sell the betel leaf, but he does not have money to buy an initial stock to continue his business. 

Therefore, Hameeda requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can buy an initial stock, such as a mixture of chopped or coarsely ground areca nuts, mint, coconut, fruit preserves, gulkand (rose petal preserves), various spices, and powdered tobacco.

loans.use: to buy an initial stock of betel leaf and related goods for her son to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Adji Magatte

texts.fr: Madame Adji Magatte est une femme mariée et mère de 03 enfants, elle habite à coté du guichet et évolue dans la commercialisation de Wax, Bazin et Khartoum ; des tissus très prisées dans cette localité. Elle a lune expérience de plus de 6 ans et aide son mari dans la gestion des charges et dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Madame Adji Magatte sollicite ce prêt d’un montant de 400.000F pour renforcer son fond de roulement et satisfaire ses clients. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 15h car elle doit revenir à la maison pour faire le ménage.  Avec l’aide de l’institution, elle va diversifier ses produits, épargner et ensuite améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Adji Magatte is married and the mother of three. She lives not far from our branch and works selling traditional fabrics (wax, bazin and khartoum), which are very popular in this region. She has an experience of over six years and helps her husband with everyday family expenses. Adji Magatte is seeking this loan in the amount of 400,000 West African francs in order to reinforce her working capital and meet customer expectations. She starts her day at 9 AM and finish at 3 PM as she needs to return home to take care of household tasks. With the help of the microfinance institution, she will diversify her products, save money and eventually improve the life conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Milagros Del Socorro

texts.es:
Milagros del Socorro tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas marcianos y cerveza, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, esta actividad lo realiza desde hace 5 años por lo que tiene una considerable clientela.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de productos de primera necesidad, leche, azúcar, arroz, aceite, fideos, harinas y de esta manera incrementar su negocio, ofreciendo más variedad de productos a sus clientes y al mismo tiempo mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Milagros del Socorro is 30 years old and lives alongside her family in the district of Buenos Aires. Its population is dedicated to farming, trading and livestock and it is located two hours from the city of Piura on the north coast of Peru.

She is dedicated to selling drinks and beer. Her business is located in her house. She has done this work for 5 years so she has a considerable number of customers.

She has requested a loan of 1000 PEN to buy basic necessity products like milk, sugar, rice, oil, noodles, flour and thus expand her business, offering a greater variety of products to her customers and, at the same time, earn greater income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic necessity product to stock her business.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Meet Teresia, a 60-year-old farmer who has seven children and has been doing farming for seven years. She hails from Kisii land.

Farming is her major source of income where she produces and sells milk, eggs, bananas, and sugarcane. In farming, she states that she enjoys dairy farming the most because she gets a lot of income from it, while her challenge is being able to access feed for her livestock.

Teresia chose Juhudi Kilimo because it offers training to farmers before taking a loan and they have a repayment interest rate that is affordable. 

This loan will help her to add more dairy cows and, thus, should result in more income, which will lead to better living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are local residents.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of  funds. He will use the KES 70,000 loan to add stock of meat.

His business goal is to open another business within five years.  He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of meat

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is hard-working and enterprising.. She is the widowed mother of two children, who are adults. She owns a house that has neither  electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanatumu prepares dumplings using sugar, cooking oil, and wheat flour and sells to neighbors and passersby.She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married, with four children. She describes herself to be motivated and creative. 

She operates a clothes store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are local residents.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of  funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to her stock of clothes. 

She hopes that in the future, she will live a happy and healthy life. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.  

Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add to her stock of clothes

loans.name: Aisulu

texts.ru: Айсулу 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Все дети -студенты. Супруг работает водителем грузового авто, а также помогает по хозяйству. У Айсулу - средне-специальное образование, по характеру Айсулу энергичная, жизнерадостная. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айсулу занимается животноводством, стартовав 26 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айсулу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айсулу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку кобылы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айсулу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Aisulu is 45 years old, married, and together with her husband is bringing up three children. All the children are students. Her husband works as a driver of freight vehicles, and also helps around the homestead. Aisulu has a specialized high school education. By character, Aisulu is energetic and cheerful.

As a main source of income for her family, Aisulu raises livestock, having started 26 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 1,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Aisulu currently has on her homestead: two dairy cows and 15 sheep. Monthly income consists of 15,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further develiping her homestead, Aisulu turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy a mare to increase the headcount of livestock.

Aisulu plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the quantity of domestic livestock, and plans to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy a mare

loans.name: Uma

texts.en:
Uma is a 42-year-old housewife. She is married to Samir, age 51 years, and raising two children (one daughter and one son).  They live in their own semi-pacca (brick-built wall and thatch roof) in a small village Anandanagar in Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri. Rakhi received education up to class VIII ( Grade 8), whereas her husband completed higher secondary education (Grade 12).  Both of their children receive education.  One is in college (receiving a bachelor's degree) and the other is in class XII (Grade 12). Uma's husband is a car driver by profession. But his income is not sufficient to run such a big family.

Uma started her business of selling sarees (an Indian traditional dress for women) to help her husband. She sells sarees mainly to her friends and neighbors. She would like to get a loan to buy many varieties of sarees and expand her business to meet her customers' needs as well as to upgrade her family's financial condition. The profits generated from the business will be used to build up her savings and also help her to give her children a better education.

Her dream is to give financial support for the betterment of her family and to purchase a shop in the local market to expand her business.

She is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase sarees (Indian clothing) for expanding her existing business.

loans.name: Agatta

texts.en: Agatta is a hardworking woman who struggles to meet the demands of her family. She appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu at large a great deal. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 15,000 to buy hair conditioners, shampoo, braids and oils for the hair.

loans.use: to buy hair conditioners, shampoo, braids and oils for the hair.

loans.name: Zuma Group

texts.en:
Husna, who in her early 40s, is married and has three children, two sons and one daughter, who are still at school. 

She has two businesses: a pharmacy as the main business, and a brick-making business.  She has been in this business for six years now. She works from 7:30 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly income.

This will be Husna's ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy medicines, which are fast-moving and in demand.  She also bought sand and cement for making bricks. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy medicines, sand and sacks of cement.  She dreams of owning a dispensary.

Husna will share this loan with her loan group, "Zuma," which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy medicines, sand and sacks of cement.

loans.name: Pamba Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma, who is in her mid 30s, is married and has three daughters. One of her daughters is in school while two are still young. 

For seven years now, Mwajuma has been running several businesses: a beauty salon, a cosmetics business and a genge-duka, a grocery stall selling fruits and vegetables and other retail shop items. She employs helpers who run the business activities. Her businesses work from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. per working day and she is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to open a genge-duka business, to buy stocks of cosmetics and women's clothes and to repair her genge-duka place to look attractive. Mwajuma also purchased stocks of fruits, vegetables,cooking oil, sugar and other items. She has paid back all her previous loans successfully. 

Mwajuma will use this loan to restock all her businesses with new items. She hopes to have successfully businesses. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Pamba," which totals 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock her businesses with new items.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente de 27 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios de uso personal su negocio lo tiene ubicado en las afueras de su casa, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los materiales necesarios como cemento, hierro y maya ciclón para construir un muro en la parte de enfrente de su casa y asi puedan vivir mas seguros con su familia.
texts.en:
This borrower, age 27, lives in his own house with his family.  He works selling clothing and personal accessories.  His business is located in the outer part of his home.  With what he earns from his job he is able to take care of some of the household expenses.  

He wants to improve his house but with what he earns he can’t quite manage to do it.  The borrower is asking for a loan to be able to buy the materials he needs, such as cement, iron, and hurricane fencing, to build a wall in front of his home and so to be able to live more safely with his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, and hurricane fencing

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a butcher shop business, selling meat at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase seven goats to slaughter for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven goats to slaughter for sale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman and blessed with two children, both of whom go to school. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Asha operates a tailoring business, making women’s and gents' suits for sale at home. She cites delayed payments and stiff competition from other tailors to be her major challenges. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a hard-working woman who runs a poultry business. She supports her family through the income earned from the business. The previous loan helped her to buy chicks for the business. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy chicken feed and medicine for the hens and she appreciates the support accorded her.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and medicine for the hens

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine appreciates the previous loan which helped her to boost her welding business. Currently she operates an additional business of a salon to boost her income. She comes to you again requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy hair weaves, hair oils, shampoo and hair treatments for her business.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves, hair oils, shampoo and hair treatments for her business.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia’s age is 32; she is married, living with her husband and eight children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a welder and provides welding services in his community. Shazia owns a small clothing business at home. She purchases clothes from the market at low prices and sells them at a higher price in her community. The ladies of the town like her garment selection a lot. Her family members appreciate her for her efforts. 

Now the winter season is starting and she wants to buy winter season clothes to sell. But she does not have the necessary amount due to household expenses.  She requested a loan so she can buy winter season clothing to meet the demand. She wishes for a bright future for her children and her dream is to provide better education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy winter season clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rasoul

texts.en:
Rasoul, 34 years old, is an Iraqi client who is married and has two children. He is the only provider in the family. Rasoul owns a small shop selling mobile phones and their accessories. In his shop, he has a wide collection of all known mobiles in the market and also all their accessories, like headsets and covers. He also provides services like downloading music and ringtones as well as selling charging cards. He established his business in 2009, and since then, he has been well known in the market and has gained a good reputation. 

Rasoul is requesting a $3,000 loan. This loan will be used to install new aluminum shelves in his shop and to make a second ceiling. Rasoul aims to grow his business and increase his assets so he may provide more services and make more income so he will be able to provide his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to install new aluminum shelves in his shop and to make a second ceiling

loans.name: Michelle Tatiana

texts.es:
Hola ella es michelle, vive en la ciudad de bogotà, actualmente vive con la mama, la tía y una prima, termino el bachillerato este año a mitad del mismo, entro a estudiar auxiliar farmacéutico el primer semestre de este año. ya que le llamo la atención porque por medio de este puede conocer mas acerca de los tipos de medicamentos que existen y que puede recomendar a las personas, le gustaría realizar una especialización de esta misma para mas adelante tener un trabajo bueno donde pueda tener un nivel económico estable.
También le gustaría en un futuro poder recomendar a esta institución educativa, ya que su atención es buena y su nivel educativo es bastante bueno con esto muchos jóvenes podrían aprovechar la oportunidad que se les da.
No tiene un nivel económico bueno, pero tampoco malo, su ayuda por medio de kiva le podría servir bastante para continuar con su estudio.
Lo que piensa a corto plazo es terminar el semestre con un buen puntaje para que a si mismo la tengan en cuenta para las practicas.
Lo que piensa a medio plazo es pasar las practicas y graduarse obteniendo las felicitaciones de los profesores, compañeros y familia.
Lo que piensa a largo plazo es poder hacer la especialización, conseguir un trabajo estable para poder que pueda hacerse cargo de los gastos.
texts.en:
Michelle lives in Bogotá with her mother, her aunt and a cousin. She finished high-school this year and started her first semester to become a pharmacy assistant. She was attracted to it because she can learn more about medicines and help people. She would like to specialize so that she can have a good job in the future and a stable financial situation. She would also like to recommend this school in the future because its service and education level are very good and young people would benefit from the opportunity it offers. 

She does not have a good financial situation, but it is not bad either. This Kiva loan would be very helpful in continuing with her studies. In the short-term, she plans to finish the semester with good results so that she would be consider for internships. In the medium-term, she wants to do an internship and graduate with congratulations from professors, classmates and family. In the long-term, she wants to specialize, obtain a stable job and be able to cover expenses.

loans.use: to pay one semester tuition.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman. She has two children, age 4 years and 6 years. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of  funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will have a business premise. She will use the anticipated profits to support her family

loans.use: to add stock of clothes.

loans.name: Mansor Group

texts.en:
Monifeh is the featured borrower of Mansor's group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Monifeh is a 52-year-old married woman who has worked in selling Tupperware from her house for nine years.

She also works in selling special facial and beauty cosmetics to increase her income.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special released offers for the coming Christmas celebrations in both businesses to attract new customers and fulfill their needs with special gift ideas.
  
Monifeh is the lady sitting in the middle. As for the other group members, Maha is the lady wearing eyeglasses on the right, and Hayat is on the left wearing a light green top.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special released offers for the coming Christmas celebrations.

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es:
Isaias tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en el distrito de Lishinas una zona rural de Pucará, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales, comercio de los mismos y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi en el distrito de Pucara y sus caseríos aledaños, tiene una experiencia de cinco años en el rubro, también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores en la parte posterior a su domicilio.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 600 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehiculo y asi ofrecer un servicio seguro a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Isaias is a 33-year old man who lives with his wife and children in the district of Lishinas in a rural area of Pucará. People in this area make a living from cultivating fruit trees and selling the fruit, as well as from stockbreeding, two hours away from the city of Jaén, in the north mountains of Perú. 

He offers transportation services with his mototaxi in the district of Pucara and surroundings. He has 5 years of experience in this job and also breeds small animals in the rear part of his house. 

He is requesting a loan of 600 nuevos soles to invest in the maintenance of his vehicle, so that he can offer a safer service to his clients and increase the income for his family.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as motivated. She operates a grocery store where she sells fruits and vegetables. 
She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of  funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Kepha

texts.en:
Kepha is a 38-year-old farmer living in Kisii, an area known for its vast production of bananas.  He is married and has five children, all of school-going age.

He depends on farming as his main source of income.  He produces and sells milk, eggs, and tea.  Because of poor roads in the area, access to the local market becomes a big challenge to him.

Kepha chose Juhudi Kilimo because they met his needs just the way he likes it and gave him hope for growing in agribusiness.

He is borrowing to buy another cow.  This dairy loan will help him increase his income base, which in turn will help him give better education to his children and also improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nimvugwa

texts.en:
Nimvugwa is a married woman. She has two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Nimvugwa operates a chemist shop, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase more stock of human medicine and fertilizers for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of human medicine and fertilizers for resale.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en: Mwaka appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standard. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is a 29 year old married man with 2 children. He describes himself as faithful. He has operated a tailoring business for 5 years and makes new  clothes and repairs torn clothes. 

His business is located in a populated area and he has all types of customers. His biggest business challenge is lack of  funds. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase tailoring materials such as thread and fabric. He hopes that in the future, he will have a successful business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring materials such as thread and fabric.

loans.name: Pamela's Group

texts.en:
Mahanga is a group of four group-leader farmers in Webuye District, with Pamela selected as the Kiva representative.  

Pamela has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 29 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here, but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.			

Pamela is married and has five children.  She is 30 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking,  reliable,  trustworthy, and an experienced farmer.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group, savings group, prayer group, and burial committee.  Pamela has been a farmer for 13 years.  Pamela described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  

The 2013 Long Rains season won’t be Pamela’s first season with One Acre Fund.  She first joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, new farming methods, fertilizer and hybrid seeds and to earn enough to feed her family and send her  children to school.  

As an active member in her community, Pamela also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader and is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and  spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  

Pamela plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and save for the future.  Her life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because she has more profits from harvest, more of farm training, more farm group support, and is able to save money and  feed the family.

One Acre Fund focuses on working with small-holder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Pamela and the Mahanga Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  

One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to pay for hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 35-year-old. He is from Nablus and lives with his wife and two children in Balata Camp.  Balata Camp is a Palestinian refugee camp established in the northern West Bank in 1950, adjacent to the city of Nablus. It is the largest refugee camp in the West Bank.

Mohamad sews clothes in a workshop in his area. He dreams of providing good living conditions for his children’s future. He wants them to have a better life than his life so he works hard to achieve this for them.

Mohamad is asking Ryada for this loan to repair the kitchen and install kitchen cabinets. He also wants to to paint the house, which will improve the house and make it better. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to repair the kitchen and install kitchen cabinets and paint the house

loans.name: Ihab

texts.en:
Ihab is 21 years old. He lives with his family in Gaza. His life conditions prevented him from completing his higher education so he started selling curtains. He earns around $500 monthly.

In order to increase his business capital and to expand his selling capacity, Ihab asked Ryada for this youth loan. He plans to buy shelves and a sewing machine. Ihab hopes that this loan will lead to supporting the needs of his family and permit him to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy shelves and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Muashoki Group

texts.en:
Stumai, who is in her mid 50s, is married with four children, one of whom goes to school and the rest have finished schooling. For two years now, Stumai has been engaged in a Cafe business, selling cold soft drinks and cooked food. She works from 7:00am to 08:00pm each working day and is able to make a good profit every month. 

This is Stumai's first loan from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy rice, maize flour, baking flour, beans, meat, cooking oil and cold drinks. She is a good borrower with a good future. Her dream is to improve her business and be successful. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "MUASHOKI GROUP", which totals 5 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize flour, baking flour, beans, meat, cooking oil and cold drinks.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 28 years old and lives in Gaza. He sells various items like electronics and other household goods. He has been involved in the retail business for many years, and he still needs a lot of improvement, so to increase his stock he is requesting this youth loan to purchase more goods, buy shelves and decorate. Ahmad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more goods, buy shelves and decorate.

loans.name: Licel

texts.en:
Licel, 29 years of age, offers groceries within her village. From the business she manages, she is able to earn 500 to 700 Philippine pesos (PHP) daily if it is always stocked with a variety of groceries.

Now she wishes to increase her stock of groceries but she lacks capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy candies, soap, canned goods, noodles, toothbrushes, snack foods and breads. She hopes to maintain the business for the future of her family. She will manage her business well to gain a higher income and save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy candies, soap, canned goods, noodles, toothbrushes, snack foods and breads for her retail store.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred, age 29, is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.

Mildred operates a grocery vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to buy green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and fruits for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and fruits for sale.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married and has four school-going children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women and also making curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a married woman with four school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, preparing various foods such as rice, flat bread, and beans. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the KES 10,000, Mwanamkasi wants to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking oil and charcoal for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking oil and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Assumpta

texts.en:
Assumpta is a married woman. She rents a house that has no piped water or electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and fees for her two children. She has operated a tailoring business for the past 4 years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. In addition, she sells food to supplement her income. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the KES 20,000, Assumpta wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel, aged 35, is married to a delivery boy and blessed with seven children. She owns and operates a retail store in their village and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. She also sells fish for additional income. Her profits are usually spent on school allowances for their children. She wants to improve her business so she would like a loan amounting to PHP 14,000 to purchase sugar, coffee, coffee creamer, canned goods, cooking oil, breads, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that the loan she asks for will improve her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, coffee, coffee creamer, canned goods, cooking oil, breads, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is 35 years old, married, and lives with her husband and three children. She started her beauty salon business in 2012 and she was working at another salon as an employee,. This business helped the family's income because her husband's work at a public institution resulted in a low salary. 

Laila asked Ryada for this loan to buy a hair dryer and makeup tools for her salon. This will help her to improve her job, which will enable her to improve her financial situation. She is the only one who takes care of the family.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and makeup tools for her salon.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with four school-going children. She lives at a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees as her greatest monthly expense. 

Mariam has operated a cosmetic business for the past three years. Her potential customers are women. She cites price fluctuation and seasonality as her major challenges.

With the KES 20,000, Mariam wants to purchase body lotions, hair oil, jewelery, chemicals and hair conditioners for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase body lotions, hair oil, jewelery, chemicals and hair conditioners for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret operates a tailoring business. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She appreciates the previous loan which helped her to invest in her business. Here again, she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with three children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanaidi operates a food-making business, making staples like rice, beans, chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. 

With the KES 20,000, Mwanaidi wants to purchase food items, such as onions, tomatoes, wheat flour, rice, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, such as onions, tomatoes, wheat flour, rice, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Saum

texts.en:
Saum is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase hair extensions, hair treatments, and shampoos, which will help her to invest back into her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, hair treatments, and shampoos.

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
Kazem, age 33, runs a grocery store business to earn an income. He sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. He established his business in 2010. He has built up good experience in this field and is well-known in the surrounding area. He has an excellent reputation. 

Kazem is married and has no children yet. He works hard to provide his family income all by himself. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $3,000, which he will use to renovate his grocery store and to buy more goods to sell. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store and to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Seif El-Din

texts.en: Seif El-Din is an Iraqi youth client who is 23 years old and single. Seif El-Din lives with his parents and his brother. He and his father provide the family income together. Seif El-Din owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2011. He has built up good experience in this field and is becoming well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation. Seif El-Din is requesting a sum of $2,400 as a youth loan to pay the annual rent for his grocery store and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his grocery store and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 29 years of age, who is married and a father of 2 children, for whom he works hard all by himself to provide. He owns a small shop where he sells tires for all types of vehicles. He is very famous in his neighborhood since he is the only person who sells tires in the surrounding area. He established his business in 2012 and has good experience in this field and has hired an employee already.

Ahmad is requesting a sum of 2,000 USD as a youth loan to install a display window and a sunshade for his shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may be able to educate his children and provide all of their needs.

loans.use: to install a display window and a sunshade for his shop and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She operates a kiosk business in order to earn a living out of the profits. Her potential clients are fellow villagers. She dreams of establishing a big shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and sugar to sell in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Gulnaz's Group

texts.en:
Gulnaz, age 40, is a married woman. She is a hardworking and brave mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. 

Being a mother, she wants to provide better facilities to her children. This is the reason she is doing extraordinary hard work to keep her children smiling.

She has been sewing cloths since the birth of her two children, as she observed that her husband failed to provide all necessities for them. She decided to start tailoring work at home and now she is sewing the clothes of her community. She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives and local community persons.

She wants to enhance the beauty of her stitching, so she decided to buy a Juki machine. Professional persons use this machine for tailoring because it is speedy and its work is very fine.
 
She has requested a loan to buy a new Juki sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. Gulnaz is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new juki sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Handia

texts.en: Handia is 54-year-old married woman with children. Although she is uneducated, she runs a grocery store. She began her business 9 months ago. She really works hard to provide for her family. Year by year, she accumulated a good amount of money and opened a larger grocery store. This was a very good step in her business. She applied for a 70,000 YER loan to buy new products for her grocery. In future, she hopes to open another grocery in a different quarter.

loans.use: to buy new products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Kifayeh

texts.en:
Kifayeh is 41 years old. She lives in the family house in Tulkarem, with her husband and her child. 

Kifayeh sells various kinds of foodstuffs in her grocery store, such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many other items. She opened the store five years ago. Her husband works at a public institution with a low salary, so this business increased her family income.

For religious and cultural reasons, the loan officer couldn’t take a picture for Kifayeh. The one who’s pictured is Kifayeh’s husband.

Kifayeh has a shortage of money, so she is requesting a loan from Ryada to purchase foodstuffs for her grocery store, such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many other items and to make new decorations, so she would be able to increase her stock. 

Kifayeh is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business through this loan.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for her grocery store.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a farmer. He has a lovely family: his wife and three children. His children help Rashid in his work. Rashid’s wife is a housewife. His family is IDP (internally displaced persons) from Fuzuli region and now lives in Dovlatyarli village of Fuzuli region. 

Rashid has been in the animal breeding business for 12 years. He buys little calves, raises them and sells them in the bazaar to earn money. He learned this from his father and in the future, he wants his sons to be in the agriculture business too. 

Today, Rashid wants to increase his business and is requesting a loan of 2100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy more calves. Rashid is thankful to Komak and Kiva organizations for this help. In the future, he wants to start producing dairy products and selling them.

loans.use: to buy more calves.

loans.name: Talia Group

texts.en:
Dalia is the featured borrower of Talia group. She is applying for a loan with the other group members from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Dalia is a 31-year-old married mother of  three children, who has been working in beauty business for ten years to help her husband in making their living and covering their children's expenses. Dalia is a makeup artist. She works at home since she isn't financially capable of opening a separate beauty salon.

Dalia is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special autumn and winter released offers and items that will attract customers attention and increase her income, especially that they are highly requested during the coming Christmas season. 

Dalia hopes that one day she will develop her business more and will be capable of opening her own beauty salon.

Dalia is the first lady sitting from the left side of the picture. As for the other group members, Liliane is sitting in the middle and Sarah is the first from the right.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special autumn and winter released offers and items that will attract customers. attention and increase her income, especially that they are highly requested during the coming Christmas season

loans.name: Mujer Y Fortaleza  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Mujer y Fortaleza, está conformado por 15 socias quienes a pesar de las dificultades que tienen a diario nunca dejan su buen humor y carisma ya que eso les permiten continuar con alegría su día a día, se dedican a laborar en diferentes actividades económicas las mismas que les dan la oportunidad de ser independiente económicamente  y ofrecerles a sus hijos un mejor futuro. Viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, este lugar goza de una vista espectacular por lo que le llaman el mirador de la ciudad, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de animales y también laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Rosa Florinda, desde hace 2 años forma parte del grupo de crédito Mujer y Fortaleza, este grupo está conformado por mujeres luchadoras,  amables y gentiles que se apoyan mutuamente.
La Señora. Rosa Florinda tiene 45 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 3 hijos de 12, 11 y 4 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad y su ultimo hijo está estudiando en inicial, su esposo es de profesión aserrador, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Rosa Florinda se dedica a la agricultura y sus cosechas son para la venta, cría y vende cuyes y pollos, también se dedica a la atención de su tienda la cual tiene desde hace 4 años. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de víveres para ampliar su tienda. Su meta es agrandar más su tienda.
Las fotos pequeñas son de tres socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Mujer y Fortaleza loan group is made up of 15 members who, despite their daily problems, never abandon their good humor and charisma because it's what allows them to move forward happily every day.  They make a living in a variety of economic activities that have given them the opportunity to be financially independent and give their children a better future.

The members live in the area of Turi Parish in Cuenca.  This area enjoys a spectacular view, so it's known as the viewpoint of the city.  The architecture is a mix of old and new, and the residents work in agriculture, raise animals, and perform various jobs in the city.

One of the members of this group is Rosa Florinda, who has been in Mujer y Fortaleza for two years.  This group is made up of determined, friendly, and kind women who support each other mutually.

Rosa Florinda, 45, lives in a common-law relationship and has three children, ages 12, 11, and 4.  Her two oldest children attend school in the town and her youngest one is in pre-school.  Her husband's a sawyer by trade.  The house they live in is their own.

Rosa Florinda makes a living in agriculture.  She sells her harvests and raises and sells guinea pigs and chickens.  She also has had a store for four years.  She's going to invest the money from her loan in provisions because her goal is to expand her store.

The small photos are of three members who weren't able to be there when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy provisions

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married woman. She describes herself to be creative. She operates a clothes store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents.

Naomi describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of  funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.  She will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 22 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She and her boyfriend are living together and they have a 10 months old baby.

Nancy has been operating a shop where she sells used clothes. She started this business with money given to her by her boyfriend. She learned this way of selling from her mother. 

Nancy is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans to expand her business internationally and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Luvuno has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She also sells fried fish.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes, and fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes, and fish for resale.

loans.name: Mikanori

texts.en:
Mikanori is a 34 year old married man with 2 children aged 3 years and 1 year. He describes himself to be God fearing. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. 

His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be harsh climate  and high costs. 

He will use the  20,000 KES loan to purchase clothes for resale. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes to be financially stable in the future. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Begum

texts.en:
Begum, 30, is a homemaker and the mother of two daughters. Her husband Galimuddin, 35 years old, is engaged in agriculture. Both of them are illiterate and can only sign their names. One of their daughters is receiving an education and reads in class VI (Grade 6). The other is not yet school-going age.

They live in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own kaccha (straw and mud made) house.  The main source of income for the family is their agricultural activities. They have a plot of land where potatoes are grown. Her husband works from dawn to dusk to support his family financially. But it is not sufficient to help them with the household expenses and her daughter's education.

She learned that BJS provides microfinance loans to the women in rural areas. So, she applied for a loan with which she will purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers to start cultivating potatoes to sell in the market. She has chosen this business because there is a huge demand for potatoes in the local market and it will be a profitable business for them.

Her plan for the future is to keep increasing their business. This will give her more profit to improve their quality of living and help her children receive a good education. She wants to upgrade her house to a Pacca (brick built) in the future with the profit from her business.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anjana

texts.en:
Anjana is a homemaker and lives in their own kachha house (a house made of bamboo, mud and straw) with her husband Nandaram and three children. Both Anjana and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. They live in the small town of Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri . They can hardly afford the educational expenses of their children.  Two of them receive education. One is in class V (Grade 5) and the other is in class III (Grade 3). The third is below school-going age.

Anjana's husband is engaged in agriculture. They sell the agricultural products in the local market. His agricultural business is the only source of income for the family.

As life is getting more expensive over time, Anjana needs to help her husband, so she has chosen this potato cultivation business.  She applied for loans to BJS to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers. The demand for potatoes is very high in the local market.

She hopes this will give them more income to improve their quality of life and help her children's education. In the future they want to buy a cycle-van to carry their vegetables to the local market.

Her full thanks go to BJS as well as to Kiva for giving her the loan.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Kosur

texts.en: Kosur is a 41-year-old married woman doing business selling milk for the past 2 years. She has 1 cow & 1 buffalo making milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to help her family lead a decent life. It is her 3rd year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of it. Now she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es una joven de 24 años de edad luchadora, visionaria, con muchos deseos de superarse y de salir adelante madre soltera de 2 hijos quienes son menores de edad y deja al cuidado de su madre ya que ella se desplaza al campo a trabajar junto a su hermano y su padre. Ella tiene un grado de estudio primaria incompleto cursado hasta el 4 grado ya que por la falta de apoyo económico de sus padres no pudo seguir estudiando ya que ella desciende de una familia humildemente económica. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde muy pequeña ya que por vocación familiar sus padres, abuelos y demás se han dedicado al cultivo de café. Ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que por más de 5 años se ha dedicado al cultivo de café y en compañía de personas experimentadas como lo son sus familiares. El terreno que ella junto a su familia trabaja y cultiva es propio ya que fue una herencia por parte de sus padres el cual está ubicado a 40 minutos de camino desde su casa de habitación diariamente para su asistencia y otros que hacen de su cultivo productivo.
Norma solicita financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo de café ya que por medio de estos podrá obtener una cosecha sana y la podrá aprovechar al 100% para su posterior venta.
Sus metas poder ampliar y cultivar una mejor variedad que incluya otros tipos de productos como ser: maíz, frijoles, etc. que ayuden a cumplir sus sueños como los de mejorar la condición de vida para sus hijos, apoyarlos en sus estudios, y comprar un pedazo más de tierra para poder seguir cultivando.
texts.en:
Norma is a 24-year old young woman who is very hard-working and a visionary. She has a strong will to surpass herself and get ahead as a single mother of two minor children. Her mother takes care of the kids while she goes to the land to work with her brother and father. Due to a lack of financial resources, she did not finish primary school and left her studies when she was in 4th grade. She comes from a poor family and her parents taught her to work in the land when she was a little girl. Her parents, grandparents and the rest of the family have always worked in the cultivation of coffee. She now has 5 years of experience and learns from her very experienced family members. The land where they work is hers as it was inherited, and is located 40 minutes away from her house. 

Norma is requesting a loan to the cooperative COMIXMUL to buy fertilizer for coffee plantations, so that she will be able to obtain a healthy crop and sell it entirely afterwards. Her goal is to increase and improve the production so that it includes other products, such as corn, beans, etc. This would help her to meet her dream of improving the life conditions of her children, provide them with education and buy another piece of land to keep cultivating.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Latifan's Group

texts.en:
Latifan is a 48-year-old married woman. Her financial condition is not good. Her Son has been driving a moto-rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw which consists of a motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for small distances. Its body is made of polyester, which is not strong enough to bear jerking over roads. Now the rickshaw body needs to be replaced because it rattles during driving. This is the reason her son wants to buy a new body for the moto-rickshaw.

She requested a loan so that her son can maintain the rickshaw body so that he can drive it smoothly. Latifan thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body for her son.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Beatrice is 38 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married and has five children between the ages of 4 and 14, all of whom live at home and attend school.

Beatrice has been involved in sales of coal for 8 years now. She enjoys selling to customers as it enables her to help her children. Her main challenge is high transportation costs.

Beatrice is requesting a loan to purchase more coal for her business.  She would like to expand her business since she has more customers.

loans.use: to purchase more coal for her business.

loans.name: Comreds B Group

texts.en:
Hawa, who is in her early 40s, is married and has five children who are in school. Since 2003, Hawa has been a business woman with a variety of enterprises. One of her businesses is in motorbike spare parts, another is catering, where she provides food services for different functions, and lastly, Hawa manages a beauty salon business. Hawa employs a few business helpers who assist in selling. She runs her business from 7:30am to 8:00 pm each working day and is able to make a very good profit.

This is her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she will use it to buy a photocopy machine and restock spare parts to resell at her shop. She used her previous loan, which she has repaid in full, to improve her spare parts business with new spare parts which were most in demand. Hawa used her business profit to cover household expenses and reinvest back in her enterprises. She also bought a plot of land where she expects to build a very nice family house. Hawa dreams of being an international business woman.

Hawa will share this loan with her loan group "Comreds B", which totals two members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a photocopy machine and to restock spare parts to resell at her shop.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира продавщица на рынке. Она занимается продажей детской одежды. Замира замужем. Она является матерью 3-летнего мальчика и 8-летней девочки. Ее муж уехал в Россию на заработки и Замира осталась одна с детьми в районе Хамадони. Замира начала свой малый торговый бизнес два года назад и ведет его самостоятельно. Она знает потребностей своих клиентов и поэтому ее торговля идет хорошо. Сейчас она нуждается в средствах, чтобы закупить сезонный товар. В связи с этим Замира обратилась за кредитом для купли сезонной детской одежды.
texts.en: Zamira is a saleswoman at the market. She sells children's clothing. Zamira is married. She is the mother of a three-year-old boy and an eight-year-old girl. Her husband left to work in Russia, so Zamira was left alone in Hamadoni with the children. Zamira started her small resale business two years ago, and she runs it herself. She knows what her customers need; hence, business is good. Now she needs money to buy seasonal goods. Therefore, Zamira has requested a loan to buy seasonal children's clothing.

loans.use: buy seasonal children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Daleri

texts.ru: Далери молодой и прилежный студент. Ему 21 год. Он в данный момент учится на третьем курсе в Институте предпринимательства и сервиса. Далери живет в районе Рудаки вместе с родителями и сестрами. Его отец адвокат и работает в нотариальной конторе. Мать домохозяйка, а сестры учатся в школе. Сейчас Далери собирается оплатить за учебу в институте и ему не хватает немного средств. Единственное решение его семья видит в получении кредита. Далери очень надеется на финансовую поддержку. Он хочет успешно закончить институт и стать хорошим специалистом свой профессии.
texts.en: Daleri is a young and diligent student. He is 21 years old. He is currently in his third year at the Institute of Entrepreneurship and Service. Daleri lives in the Rudaki district with his parents and sisters. His father is a lawyer and works in a notary's office. His mother is a housewife, and his sisters are in school. Daleri is going to pay for his studies at the institute, but he is a bit short of money. The only solution his family sees is to take out a loan. Daleri is hoping for financial support. He wants to successfully complete college and become a good specialist in his profession.

loans.use: pay tuition.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is now requesting a loan of KES10,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Dawlat

texts.en:
Dawlat is 27 years old and lives in Gaza with her family. She started her beauty salon business in 2010, and she has had a good experience in this field. 
She asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy makeup tools and shelves for her salon. This will help her to improve her business, which will enable her to improve her financial situation.

She dreams of expanding her business, and desires to use part of the profits for her children’s future education. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her with this loan to achieve success in her business.

loans.use: to buy makeup tools and shelves for her salon. This will help her to improve her business, which will enable her to improve her financial situation.

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
Kazem is from Iraq. He is 59 years old, married and the father of 3 children. Kazem works hard to provide for his family and to educate his children. 

Kazem is a grocer. He owns a small grocery store in his neighborhood where he sells snacks, canned food, drinks and ice creams. He has been providing his family’s income through this grocery store since 2008. Kazem has gained good experience in this field. He has a hired employee and is well-known in the neighborhood.

Kazem is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his grocery store by installing new shelves on the walls of his shop and by repainting the walls of his store. Kazem believes that by renovating his grocery store, he will be able to attract more customers, and thus increase his profits. By increasing his profits, Kazem will be able to provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store by installing new shelves on the walls of his shop and by repainting the walls of his store.

loans.name: Hashem

texts.en:
Hashem is a youth client from Iraq. He is 24 years old and married. He lives with his parents and his brother. Hashem and his brother share the family’s monthly expenses together.

Hashem is a grocer. He owns a grocery store, where he sells all the basic needs of a house like dairy products, snacks, canned food, juices and detergents. He has been in this field since 2011 and has gained much experience. Hashem now has an employee and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Hashem is requesting a youth loan of 1,800 USD. The aim of this loan is to install some new blocks on the floor of his grocery store and to increase his inventory. Hashem is aiming to grow more in this field and someday open a bigger grocery store in order to sell more products and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to install some new blocks on the floor of his grocery store and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Alae

texts.en:
Alae is an Iraqi youth client who is 24 years old and lives with his family of 6 members. Five are employed and together they contribute to the family income. Alae owns a small grocery store. He sells canned food, drinks and dairy products. He has been operating this business since 2010. Regardless of his young age, his enthusiasm and wide knowledge of the market gave him a good reputation.

He is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD to pay the annual rent on his grocery store and to buy more goods to sell. Alae is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits in order to provide himself with a career and a good source for making a living.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his grocery store and to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a youth client from Iraq. He is 25 years old, single and lives with his parents. Hasan and his father provide the family income together. Hasan owns a small shop where he repairs electrical equipment like air conditioners, washing machines, refrigerators and coolers. He has been in this field since 2012 and has gained his experience in this field through previously working as an employee at a similar shop for several years. He is well-known in the neighborhood and has an excellent reputation.

Hasan is applying for a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent for his shop in instalments. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may provide a better income for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a married client from Iraq. He is 39 years old and works hard in his grocery store to provide for his family’s needs. In his grocery store, Ibrahim provides for all the basic needs of a family like dairy products, juices, canned food, snacks, shampoos and detergents. He established his business in 2008 and has gained all the needed experience through previously working at a similar grocery store for several years. 

Ibrahim has gained fame in his neighborhood thanks to the good quality and competitive prices of his offered goods. Ibrahim is requesting a loan of $3,000. He will use this loan to install a new floor in his grocery store and to increase his inventory. Ibrahim believes that this loan will allow him to increase his goods which will result in the improvement of his business and his profits and will grant him the ability to provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to install a new floor in his grocery store and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es: Don Héctor, tiene  65 años de edad, divorciado,  vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Anteriormente se dedicaba a prestar el servicio de  motorista de transporte de personas. Hace 6 años decidió dedicarse al  negocio de una pulpería, donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser granos básicos, refrescos, productos lácteos, carnes, churros, pastillas, productos enlatados, y otros abarrotes.  Ha solicitado varios prestamos a  la institución para mantener activo su negocio, actualmente solicita otro por L. 20,000.00 y va comprar mas productos como carnes, productos de lácteos, golosinas como churros, refrescos, pan, dulces y otros para surtir y vender. El tiene como meta mantener  estable y económicamente su negocio.
texts.en:
Hector is 65 years old and divorced. He lives in the municipality of San Pedro Sula. He used to work as a motorcycle transport provider for people. Six years ago, he decided to dedicate himself to a grocery store business, where he sells basic food items like bulk grains, soft drinks, dairy products, meats, churros, lozenges, canned goods and other grocery items. 

Hector has requested various loans from the institution in order to keep his business going. He is currently requesting another loan of 20,000 HNL, and he will buy more items like meats, dairy products, treats like churros, soft drinks, bread, sweets, and other items to stock his store and sell. His goal is to keep his business stable and economical.

loans.use: to buy more products like meats, dairy products and treats like churros, soft drinks, bread, sweets, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Roqia

texts.en:
Roqia is a 22-year-old single, young lady from a small village near Rafah city. She lives with her family in a simple house. Qoqia's father works in the public sector and earns a low income. Roqia studies information technology. She would like to finish her studies, get a BA degree and find a job to help her family with part of the family expenses.

Roqia took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Roqia will be able to do her homework and write the reports easily.
 
Roqia appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Tabriz

texts.en:
