Tabriz is a 36-year-old taxi driver and is married with one child. His son goes to third class. They are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Füzuli city and now live in Boyuk Bahmanli village of Fuzuli region. 

Tabriz has applied for a loan in amount of 1,500 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair his car. He has been at that business for 10 years and during those years his car was damaged. To increase his business and monthly income, the car needs to be repaired. He believes that when his car is repaired, his situation will be good enough and he will be able to support his family. 

Tabriz thanks Komak and Kiva organizations for their help. In the future he wants to replace his car.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet is a 27-year-old farmer living in Kisii land. He is married and has 2 children, both of whom depend upon him for their livelihood. Japhet produces and sells milk, eggs, and tea. He enjoys mixed farming because he gets good output out of it. After every harvest, when he has to transport his output to the local market, he experiences difficulty due to the bad roads especially when it has rained.

Japhet chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer very good financial services to small holder farmers and they also have low interest rates on their loans. He said that this loan will improve his family's living standard and give better education to his children because with the loan he will purchase a dairy cow which together with other cows will produce more milk. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for helping build his life.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a single woman with 3 children. She describes herself as God fearing and strong. She operates a retail business to sell clothes. 
She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular customers.
She describes her biggest business challenge to be high costs. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase clothes to resell. 

Her business goal is to expand  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be wealthy. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
This is Beatrice who lives at West Point in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 53 years old, completed 6th grade, and is married with five children between ages 18 and 25. They live at home and four of them attend school. 

For the past 18 years she has been operating a cook shop (local restaurant) selling rice and soup in the local market. She started this business with help from her husband, who works with a petroleum company, and learned this way of selling from her mother. She sells for 12 hours each day, every day of the week. She uses a taxi most of the time to get her stock to her shop. She enjoys the flow of customers. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more pepper, oil, onion, vita, rice, etc. to increase her sales. She wants to get more money to educate all her children and build a house. She appreciates Kiva for their continued support.

loans.use: to buy more pepper, oil, onion, vita, rice, etc. to increase her sales.

loans.name: Emma's Group

texts.en:
Emma is a member of Mulika Group in Webuye District.  She is pictured here in a group of One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 36 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Emma has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.	
						
Emma is married and has three children.  She is 25 years old and is known as friendly, hard-working, reliable and trustworthy and an experienced farmer. She is active in her community in groups such as the women's prayer group and burial committee.  Emma has been a farmer for eight years.  Emma described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  	
						
Emma joined One Acre Fund in 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Emma joined One Acre Fund so that she could get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed her family and send her children to school.  Because she is an active community member, she wants to help more farmers and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Emma has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Emma's life because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, was able to save money and was able to feed the family.  In the future, Emma hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send her children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow and a goat and invest in a business.  	
						
Emma and the Mulika Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.	
						
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy cost-efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 23-year-old married man who has one child. He describes himself to be strong and determined. He operates a business transporting customers with his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. 
His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high fuel prices. He will use the KES 15000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorbike. His business goal is to own more motorbikes within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his motorbike

loans.name: Joseetta

texts.en: Josietta is 26 years old and lives in the community of West Point, which is a well-known and populated section of Montserrado County. She is single and a high school graduate who has earned a living for the last six years by running a hair salon. Her business is running smoothly, and she is requesting this loan to buy more synthetic hair to use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy more artificial hair for her business.

loans.name: Fadhil

texts.en: Fadhil is 63 years old, married and the father of one child. He has been earning a living in the agricultural sector for 12 years, and is known as a hard worker who specializes in growing palm trees. He takes good care of his farm and grows top-quality dates, which allows him to get better prices for his goods. He has requested a loan to buy organic fertilizer and a water pump, and to renovate his farm. Fadhil expects that this loan will generate additional income that will allow him to expand his farm and move into new areas. His story is one of many examples of Izdiharona's work on behalf of economic development.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and a water pump, and to renovate his farm.

loans.name: Enoth

texts.en:
Enoth, a new borrower, is a 40-year-old married man with 5 children. He applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX to improve his farming business. His business challenge is a small yield from his banana plantation.  Enoth wants to buy more goats to rear and mulch for his banana plantation.  This will help him to earn income to look after the family. 

In the photograph, Enos (wearing the string badge around is neck) is shown with the UGAFODE credit officer.

loans.use: to buy mulch and goats.

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Ibraheem is 23 years old. He lives in Jinen. He works in a yard as an employee in his town. He is the only one of his family who is employed and helping in providing the family's income.
 
So, Ibraheem thought to ask Ryada for a loan in order to pave the ground and repair the ceiling. That will improve the house and result in better life conditions.

He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to pave the ground and repair the ceiling, to improve the house.

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr:
La dame Ndèye est une petite commerçante qui vend des produits divers et qui a redémarré son activité il y a tout juste deux ans ; activité qu’elle avait arrêté à cause de son état de grossesse. Son enfant devenu solide, elle a repris avec la vente d’encens, de pochettes et divers autres produits que sa clientèle peut lui demander et qui peut générer un bénéfice pour elle.
Ndéye est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle n’a pas de charges sinon appuyer son mari dans les petites dépenses de la maison.
Puisque l’activité a été irrégulière pendant un bout de temps, ce qu’elle veut c’est surtout l’améliorer un peu plus.
texts.en: Mrs  Ndéye  is a vendor selling miscellaneous items. She had to stop her business during her pregnancy. Now that her child has grown a bit, she has returned to selling incense,plastic pouches and other items requested by her customers,in order to generate a profit.  Ndéye  is married and has three children. She has no financial obligations oother than to help her husband with minor household expenses. Since she has not been selling regularly for a while, she would like to stabilize her business now.

loans.use: to buy various item such as incense and plastic pouches for resale.

loans.name: Merycel Karolina

texts.es: Con juegos didácticos, libros modernos y útiles escolares Marycel surtió su centro educativo infantil y ahora la calidad del servicio de sus pequeños ha mejorado sustancialmente y esto es gracias a su credikiva bien invertido. Ella dice a sus financiadores que está muy agradecida con el apoyo económico recibido y que su objetivo es continuar fortaleciendo su empresa. En la actualidad se encuentra aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento mediante el cual comprara muchos mas juegos didácticos, para abastecer el aumento de su clientela y continuar ofreciendo un impacto mayor en la comunidad educativa .
texts.en: With educational games, modern books, and school supplies, Marycel stocked her childcare center and now the quality of service for the children has greatly improved. This is thanks to her well-invested Kiva loan. To her financiers, she says that she is very grateful for the economic assistance that she has received and that her goal is to continue strengthening her business. She is asking for another loan which she will use to buy more educational games, in order to provide for the increase in clientele and continue to make an impact in the educational community.

loans.use: to buy many more educational games

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma, a married woman with no children, lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, Mwanajuma has operated a clothing sales business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of high transportation costs. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, Mwanajuma wants to purchase more bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a single woman. She describes herself as successful. She operates a retail business where she offers mobile phone-based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are business people.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add money for clients to withdraw or deposit. Her business goal is to have a fully settled business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, her business will grow big. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add money for clients to withdraw or deposit.

loans.name: Yanina Araceli

texts.es:
Yanina tiene 21 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de La Matanza una comunidad tranquila, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida y cerveza en su domicilio desde hace tres años, por lo que tiene una considerable clientela, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cerveza, sacos de maíz y azúcar para la elaboración de chicha de jora y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Yanina, 21, lives with her family in the La Matanza district, a peaceful community two hours from the city of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.  The people there work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Yanina has earned a living selling food and beer in her home for three years, so she has a lot of customers.  She has requested a loan for 3,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy beer and sacks of corn and sugar to make "chicha de jora" [corn beer] to sell to her customers and earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make corn beer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is an established farmer whose hometown is Kisii.  She has one child and has been farming for 18 years.  She produces and sells milk, eggs, tea, bananas, and sugarcane.  Farming is her livelihood.  The major challenges to farming are poor roads especially during rainy seasons and lack of well established markets.

Mary chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer low interest rates, meet farmers' needs, and offer training to farmers before providing loans. This loan will help Mary's farm to produce more milk and thus improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a 48-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 29 years. She describes herself as satisfied. She operates a retail business where she sells laboratory chemicals. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. 

Her primary customers are schools. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of a water distiller. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water distiller to produce distilled water to sell. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, her business will grow.

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water distiller.

loans.name: Lukas

texts.en:
Lukas is a 35-year-old farmer living in Kisii. He is married and has two children, both of whom are of school-going age. Besides the fact that Lukas is employed, he finds joy and pleasure in farming where he has produced and sold milk, tea, and eggs for the past 10 years. His challenge comes when he has to access the market and there is a lot of difficulty because of the weathered roads, which makes transport difficult to go through.

He chose Juhudi Kilimo because they help farmers grow economically by funding their farming activities. This loan will help him improve his family's living standards due to the increase in milk production. 

He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for helping him grow.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dison

texts.en:
Dison is a single man who describes himself as successful. He operates a retail business where he makes coffins. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a viable area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 
He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy materials for making coffins. His business goal is to have a fully settled business within five years. He hopes that in the future, his business will grow. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy materials for making coffins

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as honest. She earns a living by running a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this line of work for three years and does her selling in a busy part of town. Esther's biggest challenge is a lack of funds, and she is requesting this Kes 15,000 loan to buy more cereals to sell. Her goal is to open a shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to provide better support to her family. This is her first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more cereal to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 40 years old and lives in the West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single, and has six children between 3 and 16 years old. She did not attend school. For the past two years she has been selling charcoal in the local market. She spends eight hours each day at her business. She likes her business because she has many customers and makes lots of profit. She started this business with money given to her by brother, Most of the time she uses the bus to transport her goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans to build her own house and become an international business woman.  She says "thanks" to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business,

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger is a Cameroonian age 35. He is married with three children. The oldest is 10 and is in secondary school while the youngest is 3  and is in nursery school. He has been in this business for the past 13 years which makes him very experienced and stable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase his profit by seven percent. His standard of living will be improved.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Nazmi

texts.en: Nazmi is 26 years old and recently married. He is living in an Ashkali community with his entire family, including his wife and his brother who is also married. Nazmi works with electrical equipment, specializing in fixing electrical stoves and other items. In addition to this work he is also a master in water system installations. He is very hardworking and works many hours and jobs in order to earn a living. He has a workshop in his home and travels to where customers need his help. He is very popular in his area and has a lot of customer demand and clients, which helps him earn a good living. Now Nazmi is requesting a loan to buy a new machine for his work. This loan will help him to generate even more income and improve his business, contributing to his goal of expanding his business and being able to hire employees to help. He is very happy to have this support and appreciates all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a new machine for his work.

loans.name: Faizali

texts.ru: Файзали молодой и активный житель района Фархор. Ему 27 лет. Он женат, его жена домохозяйка. Файзали имеет высшее бухгалтерское образование. Он работает бухгалтером в сельской школе. У Файзали во дворе дома имеется коровник. Он решил начать животноводческий бизнес. Файзали интересуется купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. Он планирует совмещать свою работу с бизнесом. Начальный капитал Файзали составляет 200 долларов США. Эта маленькая сумма для открытия такого бизнеса. Поэтому он берет кредит в размере 1700 долларов. На деньги сбережения и кредита он собирается купить 4 голов крупнорогатого скота и 240 килограмм жмыха. Файзали будет откармливать скот в течение 30-35 дней и продавать на том же скотном рынке, где он будет покупать их.
texts.en:
Faizali is a young and active resident of the Farkhor region. He is 27 years old. He is married and his wife is a housewife. Faizali has higher education in accounting. He works as an accountant at a village school. 

Faizali has a cowshed in his yard. He decided to start a cattle breeding business. Faizali is interested in buying and reselling cattle. He plans to combine his work with his business. Faizali's start-up capital is 200 US dollar. This is a small sum to start such a business. Therefore he takes a loan in the amount of 1,700 US dollar. 

Faizali decided to purchase four heads of cattle and 240 kg of oil cake (fodder) for his savings and the money from the loan. Faizali will fatten cattle for a period of 30-35 days and sell them at the same cattle market as where he purchased them.

loans.use: to purchase four heads of cattle and 240 kg of oil cake (fodder) to start a cattle breeding business

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru: Махмуд 58-летний житель района Хамадони. Он многодетный отец. У него 9 детей, из которых четверо сыновей и пятеро дочерей. Махмуд всю жизнь работал усердно, чтобы обеспечивать семью. Он занимался растениеводством и по сей день занимается этим делом со своей семьей. Махмуд сейчас хочет параллельно начать еще один бизнес. Он у своих односельчан видит каким прибыльным и успешным является бизнес купля-продажа скота. И Махмуд решил тоже не отставать от них и зарабатывать таким путем. Для реализации своего намеченного бизнес плана, Махмуд просит кредит. Он собирается приобрести пару голов бычков и приступить к бизнесу. Махмуд верит в поддержку и в осуществлении его целей в канун Нового Года!
texts.en: Mahmud is a 58 year old resident of the Hamadoni region. He is the father of 9 children, with 4 sons and 5 daughters. He has worked hard all his life to provide for his family. He and his family have grown crops for a long time and now he would like to start an additional business. He sees how profitable and successful his fellow villagers are buying and selling cattle, so he has decided not to lag behind and to take this route also. To implement his intended business plan, Mahmoud asked for a loan to buy a pair of bulls and start his business. Mahmoud believes in supporting and achieving his goals as the New Year approaches!

loans.use: to purchase a pair of bulls and start a business selling cattle

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es:
Miriam de 48 años de edad, casada con dos hijos, lo cuales están bajo su responsabilidad están estudiando. Es originaria de la paz centro, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Lugar que se caracteriza por su comida típica como el quesillo, y el tiste. Ella se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, cuajadas, tiste, chicha, fósforos, golosinas, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito e invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Miriam agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener  un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Miriam is 48 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are in school.  Miriam is originally from La Paz, in the west of the country, an area known for its typical food such as "quesillo" (a cheese dish) and "tiste" (a drink made with achiote).  Miriam is hard-working, responsible, and has a desire to get ahead.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, Miriam has a grocery store, a small shop where she sells consumable goods, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, cheese, matches, sweets, fruit juices and fizzy drinks. Miriam works some twelve hours every day and runs the business out of her home.  This loan will be used to invest in working capital and stock up her grocery store with consumable goods such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, cheese, matches, sweets, fruit juices, fizzy drinks, "chicha" (a corn drink) and "tiste". This will allow Miriam to earn a higher income in the not-too-distant future.  Miriam is grateful to Kiva lenders for support poor countries such as a Nicaragua and for giving poor people an opportunity to have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock up her grocery store with consumable goods such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, cheese, matches, sweets, fruit juices, fizzy drinks, "chicha" (a corn drink) and "tiste".

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло добрая женщина. Ей 37 лет. Она вдова и имеет 4 детей. Она живет одна и занимается собственным бизнесом, уже более 1 года. Шахло изготавливает и продает пирожки, хот-дог и турецкие шаурмы. Шахло имеет свою лавочку, где она продает свои продукции. Она хочет купить корову для того, чтобы откармливать его и использовать мясо для изготовления пирожков и хот-догов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки коровы. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shahlo is a kind woman.  She is 37 years old, widowed, and has 4 children.  She lives alone and has been running her own business for more than a year.  Shahlo prepares and sells pierogis, hot dogs, and turkish shawarma.  Shahlo has her own shop where she sells her products.  She wants to purchase a cow to fatten.  She will use the meat form the cow to make pierogis and hot dogs.  She is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS to purchase a cow.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cow for her business

loans.name: Chanly

texts.en:
A 45-year-old mother of six children, residing in Ou Dong district of Kampong Speu province, Chanly is a bread-winner in the family and she strives for a living via rice farming as the main source of her income. Her supplementary income is from porridge-selling and an income from her husband's occupation via driving a taxi for a fee.  

This is the tenth cycle for Chanly with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has completely repaid, has enabled her to keep her children in school and to improve her lifestyle. 

For this cycle, Chanly wants to focus on her child’s education. Hence, she applied for an education loan to cover the tuition for her daughter, who wants to pursue her study, majoring in mathematics. Chanly hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: to cover the tuition for her daughter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Ou Dong District

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María, 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene  2 hijos y vive en el municipio de Quimistán Santa Barbara. Ella tiene su propio negocio de una pulpería, desde hace 11 años lo tiene ubicado en su casa. Vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, lácteos, harina, manteca, productos de limpieza, productos enlatados, etc.  El préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 Lempiras y es el cuarto ciclo de préstamo con la institución, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de productos básicos para la venta como ser manteca, harina, arroz, azúcar, huevos, lácteos, churros, dulces, etc. Sus planes son mantener surtido el negocio, vivir siempre con sus hijos y lograr tener otro negocio.
texts.en:
María, age 36, is married and has two children.  She lives in the town of Quimistán, Santa Barbara.  For 11 years, she has had her own business, a small grocery store.  It is located in her house.  She sells pantry staples such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, dairy products, flour, lard, cleaning products, canned goods, etc.  

The loan she is requesting is for 15,000 Lempiras.  This is her fourth loan cycle with the institution.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of basic products to sell, such as lard, flour, rice, sugar, eggs, dairy products, churros, sweets, etc.  

Her plans are to keep her business stocked, to always lives with her children, and to manage to have another business.

loans.use: to buy basic staples to sell, such as lard, flour, rice, sugar, eggs, dairy products, churros, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is married and the mother of two children. She describes herself as honest, and earns a living by running a retail business where she sells bread, milk, sugar and other household goods. She has been involved in this business for two years and operates out of a busy area. Her biggest challenge is a lack of funds. She will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy more sugar, bread and other items to sell. Her business goal is to open a supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to better support her family financially. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy sugar, bread and other items to sell

loans.name: Mirvete

texts.en:
Mirvete is a 33-year-old, married mother of four children. She lives in a minority community as a housewife, taking care of children and the home, while her husband works as a cameraman and a woodcutter, providing wood for heating in the winter. 

Mirvete owns a small, old house that is need of renovation and has not had any repairs or renovations in the past several years. Every winter, it costs a lot of money to buy coal to keep the house warm due to lack of and poor insulation, causing Mirvete’s family to often get sick and feel cold and uncomfortable. 

She needs a loan to renovate her house, to buy building materials for the façade and insulation for her house. The renovation will allow her family to live a normal and healthy life and, therefore, she really appreciates this help!

loans.use: to renovate her house by buying building materials for the façade and for insulation.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
Monsieur Cheikh, est forgeron de profession qui exerce le métier depuis plus de 10 ans. Il possède un atelier à l’entrée de la ville, qu’il a ouvert il y a seulement trois ans car il travaillait en collaboration avec d’autres par manque de moyens. Ce n’est qu’après avoir épargné pendant un bon bout de temps, qu’il a pu ouvrir son propre atelier. Il vient solliciter un crédit afin de pouvoir acheter de la ferraille, la travailler pour la revendre. Il est actif toute la journée : de 7h du matin à 18h voire 20h parfois compte tenu du marché.
 Cheikh est marié et père de quatre enfants dont il a la charge. Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de toute sa famille.
S’il a plus de moyens, il aimerait améliorer son activité, augmenter son atelier et diversifier son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheikh is a blacksmith by trade. He has been in this trade for over ten years. He owns a workshop at the town's entrance that he opened only three years ago, since he used to work in collaboration with others due to a lack of means. It was only after saving some money that he opened his own workshop. He just requested a loan to be able to purchase some ferrous metal, work it, and then resell it. He is busy all day long: 7 AM to 6 PM, indeed until 10 PM at times, given the market. 

Cheikh is a married father of four children, whom he supports. He takes care of all the family's day-to-day expenses. If he had the means, he would like to improve his business, augment his workshop, and diversify his business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, such as ferrous metals to process and resell

loans.name: Papa

texts.fr:
Papa est un jeune mécanicien de 24 ans qui a appris le métier depuis 2004 et qui veut diversifier son activité en faisant de l’élevage de poulet de chair. Il est à son second crédit à l’IMCEC, crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 30 poussins et de les élever au but de les revendre. Papa est célibataire et vit avec ses parents et ses frères et sœur. Sa participation à la dépense quotidienne n’est pas obligatoire et il le fait que quelque rare fois. Grâce au crédit, Papa a pu augmenter la quantité des poulets et satisfaire sa clientèle.
Papa veut améliorer son activité dans le temps, avoir sa propre maison et se marier.
texts.en: Papa is a young mechanic, 24 years old, who learned his trade in 2004. He wants to diversify his business by raising chickens for their meat. He is on his second IMCEC loan, which will enable him to purchase 30 chicks and raise them with the goal of reselling them. Papa is unmarried and lives with his parents, brothers, and sister. He does not have to help cover the day-to-day expenses, although he does on rare occasions. Thanks to loans, Papa was able to increase the number of chickens and meet customer expectations. He wants to improve his business over time, have his own house, and get married.

loans.use: to purchase chicks to raise and resell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family thanks to her hard work as a seamstress. She is asking for a loan to buy sewing threads, fabrics, and cloth materials for her business. She is grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy sewing threads, fabrics, and cloth materials for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has eight children. She operates a business selling livestock, which she has been doing for two years. Her business is located in a busy area. 

Mary's biggest business challenge is lack of funds. She is requesting a loan for 10,000 KES, which she will use to buy more livestock to sell. Her business goal is to buy a vehicle for transportation within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be able to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself as sincere. He operates a retail business where he sells livestock. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a highly populated area. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. He will use the 5000 KES loan to buy more livestock to sell. He hopes that in the future he will have a successful business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Mwendwa

texts.en:
Mwendwa is a 35-year-old married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as sincere. He operates a retail business where he sells cooking pans, fabric and other items. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. 

His business is located in a highly populated area. He describes his biggest business challenge as a  lack of funds. He will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more cooking pans and fabric to resell. He hopes that in the future he will have a successful business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more cooking pans and fabric to resell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 45-year-old married woman. She describes herself as faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, milk, sugar and other household goods. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a highly populated area.

She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy bread, milk, sugar and other household goods for her business. She hopes that in the future she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy bread, milk, sugar and other household goods for her business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 38 years old and lives in the West Point community, which is a populated area in Montserrado County. She is divorced with two children, ages 11 and 17. Both are going to school. 

Marie stopped her education at fourth grade, but she is a potential business woman. Her partner is not working.  Marie manages her business well in order to get some money. Over the past years she has being selling water by the sack in the local market without facing any serious problem. This business started with a little amount she got from her mother. She sells everyday, spending 12 hours with her business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more water by the sack for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more water by the sack for her business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 30-year-old married woman; she has two children. She describes herself to be sincere. 

Mercy operates a tailoring shop where she makes new clothes and repairs torn clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. 
Her business is located in  a highly populated area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fabric, thread, and other tailoring materials. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy fabric, thread, and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Anatilia Josefa

texts.es:
Anatila de 55 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo mayor de edad. Es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente  del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar por trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar ya que no contaban  con muchos recursos económicos.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en la casa de habitación.  Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa como pantalones, blusas, short, faltado, vestido, juegos de toallas, juego de camas, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Anatila agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Anatilia, who is 55, is a single mother with a grown-up son.  She comes from León in the western part of the country.  She is known as a hardworking and responsible woman who constantly strives for personal self-improvement.  Unfortunately, she did not have an education because, from an early age, she had to work to help with the household expenses since in her family money was tight.  Her determination and desire to make progress led her to set up her business selling new clothing, which she does from her home.  She puts 10 hours a day into her business, selling her products.  The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business by buying and selling clothing such as trousers, blouses, shorts, skirts, dresses, sets of towels and bedding sets so that, in the not too distant future, she can boost her income.  Anatila is grateful for the help which Kiva lenders provide for people with limited resources and for poor countries such as Nicaragua and which enables them to have a decent means of earing a living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock her business by buying and selling clothing such as trousers, blouses, shorts, skirts, dresses, sets of towels, bedding sets,

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 45 years old and lives in the Logan Town area. A first-grade dropout, she is married and has three children between the ages of 22 and 32. All of her children are in college and living on their own. Martha's husband works with one of the telecom agencies in Liberia. Martha received money from her husband to establish her business selling rice, coal, soap, red oil, cold water, and other items. Most of the time she uses a taxi to transport her goods to her table at the market. She sells for eight hours each day in a week. She appreciates her customers buying from her, and she is proud of her business because she is self-employed. Martha requested a 25,000 LRD loan to buy additional goods to sell. Her plans are to build a decent house and expand her business. She thanks you all for the support.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr:
Madame Seynabou, une dame de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants, s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 15 ans ; une activité qu’elle a hérité de ses parents. Seynabou vend des produits alimentaires divers selon la période. Présentement avec le crédit, elle va acheter des légumes, du poisson séché pour revendre. Avec les revenus de son activité, elle participe à la dépense quotidienne en augmentant sur les condiments.
Seynabou a pu améliorer les conditions alimentaires de son foyer grâce aux bénéfices obtenus et aux crédits octroyés par l’IMCEC. Puisqu’elle a de l’espace dans sa maison, elle envisage un jour de faire de l’élevage de poulets de chair et d’ovins.
texts.en:
Seynabou, a 50-year-old woman, is married and the mother of five. She has been active in commerce for over fifteen years in a business she inherited from her parents. Seynabou sells a variety of grocery items according to the season. With this loan, she will now purchase some vegetables and dried fish to resell. With the revenues from her business, she helps to cover day-to-day expenses with more food. 

Seynabou was able to improve her food situation at home thanks to the profits from loans granted by IMCEC. Since she has some space at home, she envisions raising frying chickens and goats.

loans.use: to purchase various seasonal items to resell: vegetables, dried fish,...

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Yoeurn is a villager from Takeo province’s Trang district. She is a mother of seven children, and currently she needs to support one remaining child, who is studying in a local university. For her family, one-and-one-half hectare of rice cropping and the monthly income of her husband working as village chief, are the key sources of income to cover the daily cost of living.

Yoeurn has been involved in her current business for about 33 years, and it returns her, currently, about US$6 per day. With this new loan, she is entering the second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She repaid her first loan, successfully. The positive impact of her loan has enabled her to keep her child in school, until he had finished grade 12. Now, she is seeking an education loan, to support her son to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in Law, by covering school fees for her son. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to cover university fees for her son

loans.name: Group 14 - An Thanh 01

texts.en: Ke, 28, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of approximately 600,000 VND. She is divorced and has to bring up one small child on her own. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 2003. She currently does not have a toilet at her house and has been using her neighbor's. With a portion of this loan, she will be able to buy materials to build a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Those facilities would also help her improve the health, living conditions, and safety for her and the small child, particularly at night and during rainstorms, in addition to providing convenience, cleanliness, and privacy for them while contributing to the environmental protection of the community. In the picture, Ke is the first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Group 16 - An Thanh 01

texts.en: Ms. Din, 59, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of approximately 700,000 VND. Her husband is disabled, and her family is ranked as a poor household in their community. Din and her husband are now living in a house with their grown son who is married. Her son has a child who is now studying at a secondary school. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1974. Ms. Din is fully aware of the fact that using a degraded double-pit latrine poses a health risk to her and her family members, her community, and the environment. However, she has not yet been able to construct a septic tank latrine due to a shortage of funds. With a portion of this loan, she will be able to buy materials to build a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Those facilities would help her family improve health, living conditions, and safety, particularly at night and during rainstorms. In addition, the facilities will provide convenience, cleanliness and privacy for all family members, as well as contribute to the environment protection of the community. In the picture, Ms. Din is the first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Masala Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the Masala Group. They are small-scale businesspeople, based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of SLL 1,500,000 (Sierra Leonean Leones) for each member in the group. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Mohamed. Mohamed is age 40. He was born in Makeni city, where he is currently residing, together with his wife and five children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary and secondary schools. 

For 15 years now, Mohamed has been selling mobile phones, DVDs, DVD players, and other electrical equipment. With this loan, he is going to buy a large quantity of mobile phones, DVDs, DVD players, and other electrical devices, to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of mobile phones, DVDs, DVD players, and other electrical devices, to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
Finda is 48 years old and lives in Paynesville, which is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County; she is married and has four children, ages 6, 16, 20, and 27.  They all live at home, and only three attend school. 

Finda was unable to attend school, but she is good at managing her business. Her husband is a businessman. For the past three years, she has been selling used clothes in the local market.  She has no problems with the business.  

She sells every day, and spends 12 hours with her business, which she started with a little income she received from her husband. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a married woman; she has four children with ages ranging from 6 to 18. She describes herself as an experienced person. 

She operates a beauty salon, where she offers hair dressing services. She has been involved in this business for ten years. 
Her business is located in a viable place, and her primary customers are local consumers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital and space. 

Phoebe will use the Kes 30,000 loan to add a stock of beauty products to use in the salon. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful entrepreneur. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM; the previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: add a stock of beauty products

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a married woman, and she has three children. She describes herself to be experienced. 

Beth operates a restaurant where she sells cooked food. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a competitive place, and her primary customers are local consumers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase utensils to use in the restaurant. 

Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase utensils to use in the restaurant

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie lives at Sinkor in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia, well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 35 years old and is married to a teacher. They have 3 children between the ages of 5 and 14 who are in school and live at home. Over the past 4 years now, Annie has been running a table market where she sells palm oil and oranges. She started this business with help from her husband and learned this way of selling from him. She likes her business because it gives her more profits and makes her popular. She is requesting a loan to buy more palm oil and oranges for her business. She wants to earn more money to build her house.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil and oranges for her business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a Kiva borrower. She has 2 children and describes herself to be sincere. Catherine operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a highly populated place and she has customers of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to add to her stock of clothes for resale. Her business goal is to be successful and own a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: add to her stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 60 years old and lives in the town of Dansoman in the region of greater-Accra in Ghana. She is a widow and has four children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past 20 years, Alice has been working hard to manage her ready-made shop, where she sells children's dresses like the one she is holding in the photo. 

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of GHS 2,000 from ID-Ghana. The loan will be used for business expansion and to buy more children's dresses to sell during the Christmas festivity period. This will help Alice to generate greater profits and educate her children. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open up more shops.

loans.use: To buy more children's dresses to sell during the Christmas festivity period.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is a 37-year-old married man from Jenin city. He lives with his wife and two kids, one son and one daughter, in a small house in the city. Husam has worked as a farmer in the family land for ten years. He plants olive trees and wheat and sells the produce in the local market.

Husam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy seeds and seedlings to improve his farm and expand it. By taking this loan. Husam will be able to improve his farm and increase productivity. 

Husam appears in the photo in his farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds and seedlings to improve his farm and expand it

loans.name: Marcia Elena

texts.es:
Marcia de 45 años de edad, madres solteras con dos hijos menores de edad, es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a  trabajar desde muy temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha para brindarles mejores oportunidades a sus hijos y coronar sus sueños como es formarlos en profesionales de bien. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva como pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, ropa de cama, ropa interior, toallas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Marcia is a 45 year old single mother with two minor children. She's a native of Leon, which is in the western part of the country, and is known as a hardworking and responsible person who wants to improve herself. Unfortunately, the lack of financial resources prevented her from completing school and she had no choice but to work at a very young age to help with household expenses. She currently works hard to provide her children with better opportunities and achieve her dream of making them proper professionals. Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead she works in the sale of new clothes such as pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, pajamas, undergarments, and towels. She devotes 10 hours a day to selling her products and the purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her clothing business, so that she can increase her income in the near future.

loans.use: To invest in working capital and stock her clothing business with pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, pajamas, undergarments, and towels.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is 22 years old. She lives with her family in Gaza. They live a simple life; they help each other hand by hand to insure good living conditions and avoid asking help from anyone. Eman got the idea to help her family by tutoring students in the area where she lives.
Eman works hard to support her family, so she wants to use one room from her family’s house to tutor students and she needs to buy equipment like a blackboard, chalk, and five chairs, so she applied to Ryada for a youth loan.

Eman is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success.

loans.use: to buy equipment such as a blackboard, chalk, and five chairs

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en: Zahida is a 23-year-old woman.  She is a mother of three children. She got married at a very young age. She dreams of providing a quality education to her children and to be successful in life.  She lives in Lahore, Pakistan.  She is a responsible mother of 3 children.  Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession.  For the past several days, his rickshaw has not been working properly.  Because of this he is unable to generate any amount of income.  He wants to repair it as soon as possible.  However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.  Therefore Zahida, as a member of a two person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.  Zahida is very much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab studied and graduated from the Medical Institute with a specialty in microscopic and laboratory analysis. She always wanted to have her private business built on her specialty, and in 1993 she was finally able to establish it. With over 10 years experience she remembers that one of the main challenges for her to start up her business was the fact that the nature of her business obviously requires her to be located close to doctors and clinics. This means being new in an area where such businesses and offices are concentrated in, where rent is expensive, space is difficult to find, and establishing reputation as a newcomer is challenging.

Zainab has not only overcome those initial challenges, by now she has built a reputation through her precise work and genuine work ethic. Respected by peers and family, Zainab speaks highly of her husband who has been supporting her in all her endeavours. With such support Zainab is not only a successfully laboratory owner, but she is also a respected mother of 4 children.

Her children and husband are proud of her achievements, and Zainab has more ambitious goals to attain in the future. She would like to continuously improve to eventually become the best in her city and accredited by the doctors and clinics in the area.

Her growing business and enthusiasm built on a truly scientific foundation qualifies Zaineb to participate in the WLIFT special training program for SME clients and have also made her eligible to take a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq to purchase a new machine with all its utilities for hormone analysis.

As she explains with her own words: I’m Zainab, Laboratorial Assistant (this is the official title for graduates from Technical Colleges with Diploma “two year study”), I would like to get a loan from Relief International for the purpose of purchasing an analysis/system device to improve/speed up my work. Thank you very much.  

In addition to the investment in the business, from the training Zainab hopes to gain in-depth knowledge to develop the business and serve her clients better through improved administrative and management skills.

loans.use: to purchase a hormone analysis machine with all its utilities for the lab

loans.name: Group 17 - An Thanh 01

texts.en: Ms. Man, 43, works in agricultural production and earns a monthly income of approximately 700,000 VND. She is the group leader of loan group number 17, which is comprised of 10 households of An Thanh commune, in Tu Ky District. She is married and has two children who are attending high school. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1989. Her family and other members of the loan group currently do not have septic tank latrines, and they are still using degraded double-pit latrines. With a portion of this loan, which is 10,000,000 VND per member, Ms. Man and other group members will build septic tank latrines and hand-washing devices with soap. This will improve their living conditions and the local community, as well as contribute to environmental protection. In the picture, Ms. Man is standing in the second row, third from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 37 years old and lives in Logan Town. She is married to a mechanic, and they have three children between the ages of 4 and 16, all of whom attend school. The last grade Florence attended was 9th grade. Florence has been operating a little shop for the past five years selling pepper, oil, biscuits, etc. in the local market. She mentioned high USD rates as her challenge. She’s requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, oil, biscuits, etc. for her business. She hopes to extend her business in other counties and send her children to college in future.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, oil, biscuits, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Daissy

texts.es:
Daissy es una niña cuyos objetivos son culminar la carrera que empezó el semestre pasado en una de las sedes de campo alto.
En enero de 2014 ella inicia su segundo semestre de auxiliar administrativo en salud y quiere que kiva le pueda aprestar su convenio nuevamente para su segundo semestre y a si continuar con el programa en el que esta motivada para culminarlo y hacer de ella  una excelente profesional y estilo de vida.
Ella esta muy motivada, para si mismo empezar su segundo semestre y continuar con el sueño de tener una carrera establecida.
Encontrar un trabajo y una estabilidad económica para ella es importante, pero para ello necesita terminar la carrera que comenzó el semestre pasado, la ayuda que a ella le brindo kiva fue muy importante ya que sin esa ayuda hubiera sido muy complicado poder iniciar sus estudios universitarios, de igual manera también necesita de la ayuda de kiva para iniciar su segundo semestre.
texts.en:
Daissy is a young woman whose goal is to finish the program she started last semester at one of the campuses of CampoAlto.

In January 2014 she starts her second semester in the health care assistant program.  She wants another Kiva loan for her second semester.  This way she can continue with the program she's motivated to complete and become a professional and have an excellent lifestyle.  She's very motivated to begin the semester and have an established career.

It's very important to Daissy to find a job and financial stability.  She needs to finish the program she began last semester, however.  The help she received from Kiva was very important because it would have been very difficult to undertake her college studies without it.  Daissy needs help from Kiva to start her second semester as well.

loans.use: to pay her tuition for the semester

loans.name: Mujeres Del Sector Terminal Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, “Mujeres del Sector Terminal” is composed of ten hardworking women whose average age is 31 years. Each averages four children and although each has less than a year of formal education, the women realize how important it is for their children. Most of the ladies do not speak Spanish but rather their native Mayan language, “Kiche”. They live in a remote rural community in Chichicastenango, Guatemala.

Eva is 24 years of age and brand new to the Trust Bank. She is married to a masonry assistant and they have three children who range in age from three to six. This industrious young woman raises pigs and chickens and is in need of financial capital so she can purchase more animals. For this reason, she joined “Mujeres del Sector Terminal” and applied for her first loan. Eva intends to buy at least two pigs and ten chickens and will purchase feed to fatten them as well. She is excited to be part of the Trust Bank. All the women are very dynamic and share the same goal which is to help their families move forward.

The ladies of “Mujeres del Sector Terminal” really enjoy the non-formal education trainings on topics like women's health, self-esteem, children’s education, hygiene, money management, and business administration. These trainings are part of the monthly meetings facilitated by a Trust Bank officer from Friendship Bridge. The women participate in these trainings by sharing experiences as well as giving their opinions and personal examples.

All of the ladies of the Trust Bank “Mujeres del Sector Terminal” are infinitely grateful to KIVA investors throughout the world for the opportunity to secure a loan. The funds help them to grow their businesses, increase their family income and improve their quality of life. They look forward to a brighter future as empowered women eliminating poverty.

loans.use: To buy two pigs and ten chikens.

loans.name: Las Florecitas Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Floreitas” or “The Little Flowers” is made up of 12 women in a rural community of Chichicastenango. There are four new members in the Trust Bank.

Silvia, a 25 year-old mother of a beautiful 4-year-old boy, is one of the new members of the Trust Bank. Her business, which is about 2 years old, is to buy and sell fruits and vegetables. She does not have to travel far to purchase apples as the area is an area of apple production. Sylvia currently sells to wholesalers and came to realize that she did not have enough financial capital. So, she joined the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Florecitas” so that she can purchase more products in bulk like watermelons, pineapples, plantains, bananas and melons, as well as potatoes, carrots and onions. Silvia travels to two different towns to buy and sell her products. She does this 2 or 3 days each week so that leaves her time to spend with her family.

Silvia and the rest of the ladies in the Trust Bank learn a great deal from the educational trainings that they participate in during their monthly meetings on subjects like self-esteem, women’s rights, business management, nutrition and medicinal plants. This month, they are learning about the importance of children’s education. Many of the ladies have had little or no education so this is vitally important.

All of the ladies in the Trust Bank are most appreciative of the financial support given to them by KIVA investors through Friendship Bridge. They have hope for a more successful future because they have the tools to empower themselves and grow their businesses, benefiting themselves, their families and their community

loans.use: To buy products in bulk like fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés tiene 66 años de edad vive junto a su esposo e hijo en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio de dulces tradicionales elaborados por la misma población y ganadería, a una hora con cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de patos, pollos, gallinas ponedoras y vacas lecheras, es conocida por la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de una vaca y de esta manera ofrecer la leche a sus clientes que la mayor parte se dedica a la elaboración de dulces de Zaña, y así generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Inés, 66, lives with her husband and son in the Zaña district, located an hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's north coast. The residents farm, make traditional candies, and raise livestock. Inés raises turkeys, laying hens, and milk cows and is renowned for her work. She has applied for a loan of 2500 nuevos soles to buy a cow and sell milk to her customers, the majority of whom make Zaña candies, and to earn more for her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 45 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with four children with ages ranging from 7 to 21, who attend school and live at home. She has been selling onions, rice, tomatoes, oil, etc for the past few years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned the ways of the business from her husband. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profits. She is requesting a loan to purchase more onions, rice, tomatoes, oil, etc. for her business. In the future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, rice, tomatoes, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu is 45 years old and live in Montserrado County which has the largest port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married and has two children, seven and nine years old, who are in school and live at home.  

Bendu has been selling soap, sugar, oil, and other items in the local market for the past three years. She started this business with money that she received from her mother. Her favorite part about the business is that she makes more profit. 

Bendu is requesting a loan to purchase more soap, sugar, oil, and other items for for her business. In the future, she wants to build her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, sugar, oil, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Benakor

texts.en:
Benakor is 47 years old and lives in Montserrado County which has the largest port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is unmarried with three children between the ages of 13 and 21 years old. Her children are in school and live at home. 

For the past two years she has been selling flours, sugars, and oil in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her fiance. She spends nine hours each day on her business and is good at managing it. 

Benakor is requesting a loan to purchase more flours, sugars, and oil for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She appreciates the supporters of BRAC Liberia and promises to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase more flours, sugars, and oil for her business

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a 42-year-old Cameroonian and is married with five children. The oldest child is twelve years old and is in secondary school; the youngest child is three years old and in nursery school. 

Jean has been in this business for the past seven years which makes him very experienced and stable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. 

Jean thinks that this loan will increase his profit by 20 percent. His standard of living will be improved as well.

loans.use: to buy items for resale.

loans.name: César

texts.en: Cesar is a sheep farmer on the Tlaxcalan high plains. He lives in an region that has urbanized significantly over the past few years; the waste produced by his animals was not an issue when he started farming but it is now. His neighbors are bothered by the flies and smells, and Cesar finds himself with less space to pile up his sheep droppings. He is investing in a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa digester to take care of this problem while also benefiting him economically and mitigating the environmental impact of his farm. The biodigester kit will treat his animal waste to produce potent fertilizer for use on his crops, and rich, renewable biogas to displace the expensive, fossil-fuel based propane his family currently uses to heat bath water and cook. This loan represents 52% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is 40 years old and lives in Jinen with his wife. He sells various kinds of foodstuff such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juice, macaroni, etc. from his rented market that he opened 5 years ago.

Abdullah is requesting a loan to buy goods to sell like food, soft drinks, cookies, and candies to increase his stock. He is working hard to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. He hopes in the future to buy a grocery store of his own. Abdullah is very grateful to everyone who helps him achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy food for resale like food, soft drinks, cookies, and candies

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Ibraheem is 24 years old and he lives in Ramallah.  He works in his workshop repairing electronic machines, especially refrigerators. He has been involved in the retail business for many years.

He has good experience, but he still needs a lot of improvement, so he is requesting a loan of $2,000 to purchase repairing tools so he will be able to serve his costumers faster.

Ibraheem is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase repairing tools so he will be able to serve his costumers faster

loans.name: Yahia

texts.en:
Yahia is 38 years old. He lives in Ramallah with his wife and two children. He sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many other items in his grocery store. He opened it two years ago.

Yahia is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase a display box and shelves. This will allow him to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. His dream is to expand his business and he wants to use part of his profits for his children’s education in the future. Yahia is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a display box and shelves, which will allow him to increase his stock.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is a very hardworking and enterprising man who says that he has been able to greatly increase his income and help his family, thanks to his hard work.

He is asking for a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more stock of fish,cooking oil, and firewood for his business. He is grateful for the financial support he has received.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish, cooking oil, and firewood for his business

loans.name: Shukria

texts.en:
Shukria is an incredibly hard working Iraqi woman who has built a business from scratch against all odds using the ingredients of ambition, will, and basic skills.

With 20 years experience as a professional, Shukria remembers when she fell in love with sewing, tailoring and embroidery. As a little girl she would make clothes for her dolls. With this love and passion she developed her skills and became a professional seamstress. With skill, passion, and ambition she grew the business and currently employs 3 other seamstresses. It is also used as a facility to train other women who would like to learn and work in this sector.  

At the start of the business she faced many challenges; one of the biggest ones was the high rent of shops, but with a little creativity and a lot of work, she managed to find an interesting solution. She rented a property from the government for 25 years and had a modest, but sufficient, building built on it, which is perfectly suitable for the sewing workshop.   

Her creativity, dedication and potential for continued growth qualifies her to participate in the WLIFT training program and to take an SME loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq. She would like purchase additional, high quality embroidery machines which will enable her to provide a new set of services and deliver more competitive products. 

As she explains with their own words: I’m Shukria. I’ve been a tailor for 20 years. I want to develop my business and improve my factory. With the help of Relief International, I will advance my business. I will purchase good quality embroidery machines to improve my services. Now I have three female workers with me, and, with God’s will, the number of workers will increase to more than seven, as I have a big space and five sewing machines.

Shukria is a member of the industry union and constantly keeps an eye on the type of services in demand. The in-demand embroidery is one of these services she has learned about and would like to add to improve her business opportunities. 

Shukria is 45 years old. She is a widow and a mother of 2 children whom she is supporting and raising alone – showing a great example to all children in the neighborhood about what hard work can achieve.  She is well respected, and although she did not receive a formal education, she has had a lifelong learning experience and has become a business woman with sustainable income.   

She would like to continue to grow, increase her income and continue to be a respected valuable member of her community.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery machines and hire more women to work in the workshop

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is 51 years old married woman and mother of three children.  

The man shown in the photo is Safia’s son who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to help meet the family's expenses.

Now the rickshaw needs maintenance to keep it in functional condition. For this reason, Safia has applied for a loan of Rs 45,000, for her son.  He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Safia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her son's rickshaw.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is a local counselor who lives in Seguku and is a primary teacher by profession.  Since her childhood, Cissy has been cooking with firewood and later graduated to charcoal.  The negative effects of traditional fuels were known to Cissy, but her challenge has always been the initial cost of accessing the stoves together with the gas and its accessories.

Cooking for a family of four has not been easy most especially when there is scarcity of firewood and charcoal.  Above all, cooking with firewood leaves the home and saucepans dirty.  "Acquiring cooking gas will help me to keep our house and saucepans clean," she says.

loans.use: to buy a package of cooking gas so that she can keep her house clean

loans.name: Haniffer

texts.en:
Haniffer is a married and lives with her husband.  They have a daughter who attends primary school nearby.  The children do not eat at school so her daughter returns home to eat lunch before going back to school.  Haniffer has been struggling to cook for her daughter as sometimes the food requires warming.  Although the daughter knows how to cook, charcoal and firewood take a long time to light up.  Their daughter is either late for school or she does not even come back to eat due to the prolonged time of warming up food. 

Haniffer is now happy that her daughter will be able to prepare the food in time and won't miss lunch again.  She is happy for the support offered to her to access cooking gas through installment payments.

loans.use: to pay for clean cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) to reduce on deforestation

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is an elderly mother of three.  She is a hairdresser, but she works from home because she has do to her hairdressing and cook food as well.  Hadiya says that she usually cooks from 10am until 7pm.  She cannot afford the cost of charcoal if she is to work outside of her home.

Hadiya had seen people cooking using gas but her fear had kept her from using it as a cooking energy.  It was not until she recently attended a training session offered by WANA that she developed an interest in cooking gas.  Hadiya has received a loan from KIVA to enable her buy cooking gas.  She now plans to get a large place in a nearby trading center where she plans to promote her hairdressing business.

loans.use: to pay for cooking gas so that she can reduce the amount of smoke in the house

loans.name: Girobala

texts.en:
Girobala, 45 years, is married to Jogen.  Girobala is a loving mother of two children ( one son and one daughter). Both Girobala and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names.  They live in their own house in the small town Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri . Both their children are engaged in the agricultural activities.

Girobala's husband owns a small piece of land, where he grows different vegetables in different seasons.  Girobala, though a housewife, helps her husband in his work, after managing her household works.   Their children are his great support in his farming works. Farming is the major source of income.  He sells their products in the local market and earns money for their family.  But due to growing needs of the family they need to invest some more capital in their existing business.

Girobala heard about Kiva’s partner, BJS that they give loans to rural women for business, she asked for a loan and has decided to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers. She expects to get a profit from this business as the product has got good demand in the market.

In future, she hopes that this business will continue to grow and gain more income to improve her family's living conditions.
She conveys her thanks to both the lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is from Pakistan! She is married and has six children.
