Shamim has requested a loan for her husband. He offers alu chaat (a Pakistani food) in the evening to the common people of his area. For this purpose he needs large quantities of potatoes, tomatoes, yogurt, onion, spices and other ingredients on a daily basis. Shamim helps her husband to prepare the alu chaat at noon. He wants to offer more food to his customer because the demand has been increasing over time. This business is the reason she requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy basic ingredients in greater quantities to sell. 

She is age 36 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children. She hopes that through this loan her husband will be able to generate more income than in the past. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, the BRAC Pakistan team.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, yogurt, spices and onions for making chaat.

loans.name: Seeman

texts.en:
Seeman, age 50, is a house wife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband offers sheltering services.

Seeman is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase bamboo, nails and iron sheets for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family.

Seeman hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, nails and iron sheets

loans.name: Sanju

texts.en:
Sanju is 37 years old, married and raising four sons with her husband Sattar. They are from a small village of district Jalpaiguri, West Bengal.  They have a small kachha house (made of straw, bamboo and mud).  Both Sanju and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names.  They are providing education to their two sons, who are in grade 7.  The other two sons are working for a building contractor.

Sanju's husband owns a cycle-van.  He earns money by carrying people and goods in his cycle-van. Sanju works in animal husbandry, a business she began five years ago and which serves as a major source of income for the family. But they need more money to give financial sustenance to their family.

Sanju came to know about BJS and has taken a loan from them to purchase a cow and start a new business of milk supply and making dairy products like paneer (fresh cheese), butter and curd, which are in great demand in the present market. She will sell her products to her neighbours. She hopes to get an increase in the production of milk which, ultimately, helps in generating more cash.

She dreams of giving better education to her children, overcoming the financial hurdles, and purchasing more cows with the profit generated from her business and making a cattle herd.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to start a business selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is married and 29 years old.  She is from the rural village of North Khagrabari in Moynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband Molin and two children (one son and one daughter). Both the children go to school in in grades 5 and 4 respectively. Both Minati and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names.

Minati's husband is a labourer on daily wages, working for a building contractor.  Minati is also a very hard-working, energetic and enthusiastic woman.  After managing her household work, she works in her own animal husbandry business.  She has been working in this business of buying and selling cattle for more than seven years.  Now she wants to develop her business to give a decent lifestyle to her family which they cannot manage with their small income.

She has taken a loan from BJS to purchase a dairy cow and start a milk supply and milk products business.  She wants to make dairy items like curd, butter, paneer (fresh cheese), etc. and sell her products in her locality.  Her clients will be her neighbours, friends and relatives.

Minati puts a lot of effort into her work and for her it is a very important activity which will enable her to earn additional profit.

She wants to make her dreams true with the profit such as giving a financial up-grade to her family, providing higher education for her daughters and enhancing her business.

She thanks BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to start a business of milk supply and dairy products

loans.name: Marjina

texts.en:
Marjina is a 30-year-old housewife from Dhupguri, Stationpara in Jalpaiguri district. She is married to Majijul who is 51 years old and they have two children. Both of the parents are illiterate, but can sign their names. Amongst the children, one is studying in class VI (grade 6) and the other one in class IV (grade 4). 

Marjina's husband is a farmer. He has been involved in this agricultural field for many years. He has been farming many seasonal vegetables in their own land and selling them in the local market but he is not able to make sufficient money to fulfill his family’s daily needs. Now they are experiencing a tough time due to their poverty. 

Marjina has taken the initiative to help her husband financially. She heard that BJS (Kiva’s partner) offers loans to women in their community, so she applied for a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes in her own land along with the other vegetables. She has given preference to this business as potato cultivation is a very profitable job in her area. Potatoes have great demand in her area and they are used in most Indian dishes, so that’s why Marjina hopes she can extend her business with the profit from her business. In future she will be able to build a concrete house also, as they are too uncomfortable in their kaccha house which is made of mud and straw.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 25 years old and lives in West Point in Montserrado County, which has the largest Free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is unmarried and her fiance is a local businessman. They have a seven-year-old child who lives at home and attends school. For the past six years she has been selling slippers. She started this business with money given to her by her fiance. The business helped her save more money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for  her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for  her business.

loans.name: Abner Alfonso

texts.es:
Abner es un joven de 26 años de edad, que estudio hasta bachillerato, es casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ellos tienen un hijo de 5 años de edad y que actualmente se encuentra estudiando la preparatoria, en su vivienda viven junto a ellos sus padres  y en hermano menor de él, pero que no dependen de él. 

Abner se dedica a la venta y reparación de luces, vías y sistema eléctrico de vehículos, el junto a su hermano se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 5 años; pues ellos han visto que es una actividad que le genera muchos ingresos para él y su familia, el oficio lo aprendió de un tío que también se dedica a esta actividad, aparte de esta actividad también trabaja en un camión en transportar material para construcción. Su negocio lo tiene lejos de su casa, tiene que tomar un bus a 2 horas de camino junto a su hermano, que también le ayuda en el trabajo. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar mayor variedad de repuestos de más alta calidad, este es  un deseo que tenía desde hace tiempos de poder comprar y tener mejores productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Abner desea en un futuro, seguir estudiando y sacar una carrera universitaria, ampliar más su local  y tener más variedad de servicios para vehículos, tener más empleados laborando en su taller y para su hijo desea lo mejor que estudie mucho y pueda terminar su carrera universitaria, para que sea una persona de bien todo esto lo lograra gracias al crédito y futuros créditos que solicitara.
texts.en:
Abner, 26, finished high school and is married. His wife does the household chores, and they have a five-year-old son, who is in elementary school. They live with his parents and his younger brother, who is not his dependent. For five years, Abner and his brother have been selling and repairing lights and vehicle electrical systems, and they have seen that the business generates good income for them and their family. He learned the trade from an uncle who did the same work. He also transports building materials in his truck. His business is far from his house, and he and his brother, who helps him at work, take a two-hour bus ride to get there.  

He has applied for a loan to achieve his wish to buy a variety of high-quality spare parts to sell to his customers. In the future, Abner hopes to return to his studies and finish college, to grow his business, to offer more auto services, and to hire more employees for the shop. He wishes the best for his son and hopes he studies hard, finishes college, and becomes a great person. Abner hopes to achieve all this through the loan he has applied for and future loans.

loans.use: to achieve his wish to buy a variety of high-quality spare parts to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
A USD 1,000 loan is offered to Elisa to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as plate racks, buckets, and pans. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. 

Elisa feels so comfortable in running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Elisa independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy plate racks, buckets, and pans.

loans.name: Santina

texts.en:
Santina is 30 years old and operates a clothing shop, which she has been doing for 13 years. She opened the shop with her own working capital of $50.  She now earns a good income from her business.

Satina is requesting a loan for $1,000, which she will use to buy to church clothes, women's clothes, boys' clothes, and girls' clothes. She wants to expand her business and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase church clothes, women's clothes, boys' clothes, and girls' clothes

loans.name: Alva Luz

texts.en:
Alva is 40 years old and married with three children (ages 20, 18 and 15). She has a 6th grade education and a degree as a beautician. Two of her sons are high school graduates, one with a specialization in Administration and the other in Hotel and Tourism. Her youngest son is in 9th grade. She knows the value of education for herself and for her children.

Alva has owned a combination general store and beauty shop in San Juan del Obispo near Antigua, Guatemala for three years. Alva is seeking a loan of GTQ30,000 for expansion and growth. She has observed that many local residents take time-consuming trips to Antigua to buy things that she could be profitably selling there in San Juan. Her dream is to create a small supermarket in her building as there isn’t one locally. 

Her first steps will be to use the beauty shop area and some spare rooms in her attached home, to accommodate new product lines such as bookstore items, paper products and metal goods. She will also expand her offerings of food and household items. She will begin accepting debit cards, hire an additional worker and blanket the community with flyers and posters. It is the size and scope of what she is trying to do that make her an exceptional candidate for the advanced training and larger loan of the Namaste Starz program.

In working with Fundación Namaste Guatemaya (FNG), Alva recently completed its nine-month Basic Business Development program and increased her monthly profits by 33% to GTQ9,000. Alva is highly motivated as shown by the fact that she works 70-hour weeks to achieve her goals! Now by working with FNG’s STARZ program she is aiming for monthly profits of GTQ11,824 by the end of 2014.

The STARZ program is unique in the world of microfinance as the loan repayments are tied to the profits of the borrower instead of being fixed payments. Since loan payments are linked to profits she can ride out business cycles or other unforeseen events.

Through the STARZ program high potential women receive intensive business coaching bi-weekly over two to three years. They also receive a formal six-month education in financial literacy and business operations that leads to a diploma in Small and Medium Enterprise Management by the Guatemalan Technical Institute for Training and Productivity (INTECAP). Credit is not generally available to women with businesses of this size, so an important program element is a right-sized business loan. 

The women also receive coaching in leadership, economic and gender empowerment, and renegotiating household power relationships. By working with Fundación Namaste Guatemaya, the STARZ participant and her business advisor have a continuous-loop, real-time monitoring, evaluation and learning system.

loans.use: to pay for a new bookstore and paper products lines in her store.

location.town: San Juan del Obispo, Antigua, Sacatepéquez

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 52-year-old married father of nine children who has been working as a school bus driver for the last nine years since he retired from the army. Ahmad is working hard to develop his business to make sure that he can cover his family's increasing needs. Ahmad also takes care of other people's gardens for additional income. Today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to pay for his children's increasing school tuition fees. To make sure that he will provide them with the necessary education, he works hard to make sure that they get the best. He will also work on doing the necessary maintenance to his house before the coming winter season. Ahmad hopes to develop his business by increasing the number of buses he owns and recruiting more people to help him to provide this service.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and maintain his house for winter

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 32-year-old married father of one child. He has been working in the transportation business for 10 years. Ali has a small bus which he uses to transport people from one place to another. This is his main source of income. He wants to establish an additional business to make sure that he is capable of covering his beloved family's needs.
Today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to start a new agricultural business he will develop with his father's support. His father has wide experience in this domain so Ali will develop the business in a well-managed way.
Ali hopes that in the future and through his increasing income, he'll be capable of developing both businesses and he might buy another bus.

loans.use: To start a new agricultural business where he will develop it with his father's support

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha lives in New Kru town which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are bit difficult due to the high rate of criminals and few bathrooms,  filthy conditiosn, overpopulation, but the most interesting part is that rooms are a bit cheaper, there are options for traveling, and it contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia. 

Martha, 50 years old, is married and has five children aged from 20 to 35 years old. For the past five years now, she has been selling peppers, bitterball squash, palm-nuts, etc. She started this business with a little amount which she got from her husband. She enjoys her customers' buying and the money she generates from her business every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more peppers, bitterball squash, palm-nuts, etc. for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, bitterball squash, palm-nuts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Iglesia De Oxlajuj Group

texts.es:
La señora María es  casada. De edad 30 años. Curso 4 años de educacion primaria. Tiene 5 hijos y de ellos 3 van a la escuela. Se dedica a la crianza de pollos. Inició este negocio con el apoyo de su esposo y a la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de Pollos y para concentrado para alimentarlos. Desea en el futuro contar con un capital mayor y tener una granja con diferentes animales domésticos.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y actividades pecuarias.

En la fotografía del grupo aparecen 11 socias, pero, solamente a 10 de ellas se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Señora María is 30 years old and married.  She finished four years of elementary school.  She has five children, three of whom go to school.  She works raising chickens.  She began this business with the help of her husband and now has five years of experience.

She is organizing a group and asking for a loan to use to buy chickens and feed for them.  In the future, she’d like to be able to count on greater working capital and she’d like to have a farm with different farm animals.

The other members of the group work in trade and livestock.

Eleven members appear in the photo of the group, but only ten of them are taking out the loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Al-Hilal Mahariq Group

texts.en:
Al-Hilal Mahariq is a group consisting of four ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. 

Wafa is a 32-year-old married woman and has children. She works hard and does her best to provide her family with food and clothing. She is a housewife and dreams of raising her children well. She lives with her family in bad conditions, and she would like to buy construction supplies to use in her small house, but she suffers from a lack of money. So she is applying for a loan of 40,000 YER. In the future, she hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use in her small house.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed, 32 years old, is a married man and has children. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He works hard to provide his family with a good and healthy lifestyle. 

He has been running a spice shop for many years, in which he offers his customers all types of spice products. He has been able to attract customers after taking the first loan. He would like to acquire more products with which he can grow his business in order to achieve his objective. So, he requested a loan of 600,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB in order to buy all types of spice products. He thanks Kiva lenders for financing him with the first loan.

loans.use: to purchase all types of spices such as pepper and chili for his business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a midwife by profession with a local hospital.  She was previously living at a distance from her work.  She had planned to move some few months back to her new location, but was waiting to get enough money to help her access a cooking gas package.  Elizabeth did not wish to move to her new location and continue cooking with charcoal.  She says that her previous place was dirty due to the charcoal she used for cooking.  Unfortunately, she was not able to collect such big amounts of money in a short period of time.  She is now happy that this KIVA loan has enabled her to access gas.  She says that she has not only saved on money but also kept her room clean.

loans.use: to buy clean cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) to help keep her home clean

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude's dream has always been that she would one day use cooking gas.  It is an energy she has been hearing about but unfortunately she never had a chance of buying it due to its costs.  Although Gertrude has been comfortable with charcoal due its cost, she has come to learn its negative effects on the environment and health.  She has decided to buy the new cooking package so that she can protect the forests and also keep herself healthy.

Gertrude is happy that this program has enabled her to access Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG).  She says that had it not been for this new loan service provided by KIVA, she probably wouldn't have ever used LPG in her lifetime.

loans.use: to pay for cooking gas, in order to save on cooking energy costs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 32 years old and married with two children, who are both under five years.  She is a business woman professionally where she owns a shop which sells general merchandise.  Prior to going to the shop, Elizabeth first cooks food for her family.  She uses charcoal and firewood as her main source of energy, however she says that sometimes she opens her shop late and this is not good for her customers.  She attributes her late arrival at the shop due to the time the charcoal stove takes to light up.  Because some days she has to arrive at work early, her family misses breakfast and her young children end up drinking fizzy juice, which she knows is not healthy. 

Liquefied Petroleum Gas cooks quickly and this is the reason why Elizabeth has received a Kiva loan to support her purchase of the cooking package.   This will enable her to prepare breakfast for her family before she goes to work.  She also says that this will help her to catch up with her clients in time during early morning hours.

loans.use: to pay for a set of quick-cooking gas energy so she can save on time

loans.name: Samalie

texts.en:
Samalie is a 55-year-old female who is married with four children.  Currently, Samalie lives with her husband only and her children are with her mother-in-law.  Samalie says that their house is too small to house all of her family members.  Her children were taken away because they suffered from a cough all the time and she suspects that the cause might have been the dust from charcoal.

Samalie had heard about cooking gas, but had never thought that one day she could afford it.  She sees this as an opportunity to buy it.  She is happy that she is now going to bring back her children to the house, as they won't suffer from the dust which comes from the charcoal any more.  This loan from KIVA enabled Samalie to access cooking gas, and this will prevent her children from suffering from coughs and flu.

loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package, which will enable her to have a clean home and cook food quicker

loans.name: Group 18 - An Thanh 01

texts.en:
Thinh is 60 years old and works in agricultural production, with a monthly income of approximately 700,000 VND. Thinh and her husband are now living in a house with their grown-up son who is married. Her son has two children and they are currently attending high school.   She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1972. 

Thinh is fully aware of the fact that using a degraded double-pit latrine has the risks of potential adverse effects on the health of her family members, her community and environmental contamination. However, she has not yet been able to construct a septic tank latrine due to a shortage of funds. With a portion of this loan, she will be able to buy materials to build a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Those facilities would help her family improve their health and living conditions, while affording safety for them (particularly at night and during rainstorms). In addition this will provide convenience, cleanliness and privacy for all family members, while contributing to the environmental protection of the community. In the picture, Thinh is the second from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina is a 43-year-old woman who lives with her husband Bhaben and five children in Dhupguri. All the children are students. She has attended school up to class VIII (grade 8) but her husband is illiterate, and only knows how to sign his name. 

Mina is a homemaker while her husband is a farmer, selling different vegetables in the market. The income is so inconsistent that she is unable to cover their household expenses, but Mina dreams of providing her children proper education and making them responsible and good citizens. Mina decided to cultivate broad beans with the other vegetables in her own land as there is a great demand for broad beans in her area. In that way, she will generate more income for her family. 

Mina is confident that she will grow her business with the profit she will earn from her business. She requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc. for growing broad beans which will ultimately help in generating more income. They live in a kaccha house (made of mud and straw), so in future she wants to build a concrete house with the profit from her business.

 Mina thanks BJS and Kiva lenders for funding the loan.

loans.use: To purchase bean seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for farming broad beans in her own land.

loans.name: Anyen Pata Group

texts.fr:
Suzanne est le coordinatrice de son groupe Anyen Pata. Elle n’est pas marie et elle a 2  enfants. Elle  habite dans la region nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limité. Elle dirige son commerce de vente de produit divers pendants les 8 dernières années.

Avant de ce commercer ce commerce elle tait  a l’ecole. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce Produits alimentaire d’un  emprunt  pour le commerce tel que ventes produits cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses, etc.  Elle  dit que son défit  principal est de devenir un plus grand commerçant du nord. 

Elle  dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un plus grand commerçant qui lui facilitera  à  voyagé dans des autre pays.
texts.en:
Suzanne is the coordinator of her group Anyen Pata. She is not married and she has 2 children. She lives in the northeastern region of Haiti where electricity is rare and drinking water is scarce. She has been managing her business selling a variety of products for the past 8 years.

Before starting this business she was in school. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business. Other members need a loan for businesses such as selling cosmetics, soft drinks, etc. She says that her main challenge is to become a bigger shopkeeper in the north.

She says that her main goal is to have a bigger business which will make it easier for her to travel to other countries.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, shoes, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila tiene 63 años de edad vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña y maíz, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia se dedican a la crianza de aves de corral en la parte posterior a su domicilio, su esposo brinda servicios agrícolas, Teofila ha solicitado un préstamo de 700 nuevos soles para arreglar la pared de su casa que fue deteriorada por las constantes lluvias de la última temporada y de esta manera tener mayor seguridad donde residir.
texts.en: Teofila, 63, lives with her husband and children in the Cayalti district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's north coast. The residents grow sugar cane and corn, run businesses, and raise livestock. Teofila and her family raise barnyard animals behind their house, and her husband farms. Teofila has applied for a loan of 700 nuevos soles to fix a wall in her house that was damaged by last season's constant rains so that their house is safer.

loans.use: to fix a wall in her house.

loans.name: Katrina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Katrina works hard to support her family.

She has a business, selling fish in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  Katrina is borrowing 26,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Katrina has been sustaining her business activities through the previous eight loans she has borrowed from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business in order to secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 47 years old.  She is married and has three children.

Teresa works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items like soap, milk, sugar, coffee and noodles to sell.

Teresa has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF prior to requesting this loan.  She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming flowers.

Teresa aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like soap, milk, sugar, coffee and noodles.

loans.name: Irein

texts.en:
Irein is 27 years old and married with two children. Irein works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc.

Irein has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Irein aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 28 years old and operates a kiosk in the front of her house. She lives in a town near the school and her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to buy including students.

Julieta is requesting a loan from Tuba Rai Metin for $600, which she will use to purchase hard drinks, beer, soft drinks, water, noodles, cigarette, coffee, sugar, salt, and milk. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to purchase hard drinks, beer, soft drinks, water, noodles, cigarette, coffee, sugar, salt, and milk.

loans.name: Jerica

texts.en:
Jerica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell frozen products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional frozen products to sell in her buy and sell frozen products business.

Jerica has been in this business for ten years; she earns more income from a general store.

Jerica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional frozen products to sell

loans.name: Juvita

texts.en:
Juvita is running a kiosk that helps her generate income for her family. 

She is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business; she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as gasoline and diesel.

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 200. 

Juvita is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and diesel

loans.name: Margielina

texts.en:
Margielina is married and has four children. She works hard to support her family.  She has a handicrafts business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from buying and selling cashew nuts. 

Margielina is requesting her sixteenth loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more materials for her handicrafts business. She hopes that her hard work will help her to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing maintenance business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 11 years. She earn additional income from selling food. 

Rosalina is requesting a loan from NWTF for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fishing materials for her fishing maintenance business. She hopes to save enough money so she can buy land in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials for her business

loans.name: G.s. En Nombre De Dios Group

texts.es:
El G.S. En Nombre de Dios está conformado por tres personas dos mujeres y un hombre madres y padres responsables de ocho hijos, son originarios de Nagarote, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, Nagarote se caracteriza por su comida típica los quesillos, y por ser la ciudad más limpia de la región. Estas personas son trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la obligación de trabajar desde muy jóvenes. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Elizabeth y  tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa variada de hombre mujer y niño como pantalones, blusas, short, faldas, vestidos, camisolas, calcetines, toallas, pillamas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio y aprovechar la temporada navideña que es donde más se vende y  así en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos.  El g.s. En Nombre de Dios agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  apersonas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
G.S. En Nombre de Dios is made up of three people, two women and one man. They are responsible mothers and fathers of eight children. They originate from Nagarote, which is located in the western zone of the country. Nagarote is known for a typical dish called quesillo and for being the most clean city in the region. These people are hardworking, responsible and have great ambition. Unfortunately they were not able to study were obligated to work from a very young age.
Thanks to her strength and determination to move forward, the coordinator is Elizabeth. She sells a variety of men's, women's and children's clothes for a living like pants, blouses, shorts, skirts, dresses, camisoles, towels, and pajamas. She works in this business some 10 hours a day offering her products. The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business and take advantage of the Christmas season when sales are highest and in the not too distant future obtain better income. El G.S. En Nombre de Dios is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide people of scare resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to stock their business purchase and sale of merchandise like pants, shirts, shorts, dresses, suits,camisoles, socks, towels and pajamas.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a married man with eight school-aged children. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. The majority of his monthly expenses include food and school fees. 

For the past three years, he has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He mentioned seasonality and theft as his major challenges. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES he wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to support his business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk,s oft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Izabella

texts.en:
Izabella is a married woman and has children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for her family.

She operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable vendors in her business.
 
With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with one school-going child. She lives at her own house, which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothing business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married, with two children who go to school. They live in their own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanasiti has operated a fruits and vegetable stall for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocery in the future.

With this 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated a tailoring business, making curtains and garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With this 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Pola

texts.en:
Pola is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan of KES 60,000 to buy sacks of charcoal and bundles of firewood for her business. She is grateful for Kiva and Yehu Microfinance Trust for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and bundles of firewood for her business.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is 26 years old and lives in New Kru Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. She is married and has two children, aged five and eight. Her children are presently in school and live at home. She is a 9th grade dropout. For the past five years she has been running a table where she sells cosmetics. She started this business with money from her husband and learned this trading from her friends. She is very happy with her business because she makes lots of profits. She is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics for her business. Her plan is to build a house and improve her children's living condition even more.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Nowah

texts.en: Nowah is a 47-year-old married woman who lives in New Kru town. She has three children between the ages of 11 and 25, who are in school and live at home. For the past 10 years, she has been selling palm oil, bitter ball, pepper, and meat. She started this business with money from her husband, and learned how to sell from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, bitter ball, pepper, and meat for her business. She plans to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, bitter ball, pepper, and meat for her business.

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en:
Forty year old Miatta lives in New Kru town which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia.  Living conditions are a bit difficult due to a high crime rate, poor sanitation, filthy conditions, and over population. Some of the benefits of this area are that rooms are a bit cheaper, people have the option of traveling, one of the biggest markets in Liberia is located here, and food costs less. 

Miatta is married and has 5 children, two attend school and live at home. She was unable to attend school, but started and manages a table marketl. The loan will enable her to buy more red oil for her business. She established the business with a little money from her husband. She learned this trade by watching her mother's business. 

She enjoys having many  costumers and plans to move from a table business to a shop business.

loans.use: to buy more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Nanie live in New Kru town and is 43 years old. She is a widow with five children, who go to school and live at home. For the past four years she has been operating a small shop where she sells cow skin. She says sometimes it is slow. She started this business by selling the little stock she could afford in the  community, and learned this way of selling from her friends. 

Nanie is requesting a loan to purchase more cow skin for her business. She plans to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more cow skin for her business

loans.name: Farhia

texts.en:
Farhia is married. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water.

Farhia has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is single and lives on the outskirts of Kampala.  She owns a restaurant where she prepares food for her customers on charcoal stoves.  Harriet states that sometimes her customers do not eat her food, most especially when the food is cold and there is not enough charcoal to warm it, or if it rains and the charcoal is wet. 

Harriet has borrowed from KIVA to enable her to buy an LPG package, which is portable and will enable her to use it both at home and work.  LPG is also thermally efficient and it will enable Harriet to provide warm food to her customers.  This will increase her sales and help her sustain her business.

loans.use: to pay for a clean cooking package from Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) to help her warm food for her customers and also for use at home

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin lives with his family in Kajjansi, a sub-urban area of the Kampala metropolitan district.  He is a teacher by profession.  Martin confesses that more often than not he goes to school without breakfast, because it is sometimes very difficult for him and his partner to wake up early enough to prepare tea on a charcoal stove.  Of late, they acquired a paraffin stove.  They had hoped that this would reduce on the time of boiling water in the morning.  Unfortunately, over time they have realized that the house walls started becoming dirty due to the soot produced by the paraffin stove.  

Recently they visited a friend who acquired a cooking gas package from WANA and immediately they also showed interest.  Previously, Martin had indicated to his partner that they would wish to acquire cooking gas but, due to its initial costs, they had not been able to acquire one.  With the help of this Kiva loan, Martin and his partner are happy that they will now be having breakfast before leaving for work.

loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package so that he can reduce on the length of time used for cooking food

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a young single male who lives alone.  He is a boda boda (motorcyclist) by profession.  Emmanuel has been doing this job for the past four years.  He leaves home at 5am and returns at midnight.  Because of the short time he spends in the house, he has instead resorted to eating in restaurants rather than cooking his own food. 

He acknowledges that the food he eats is not healthy but he has no alternative.  For example, he leaves very early in the morning and at this moment he is not able to prepare tea on his charcoal stove.  He does not use electricity to cook because it is expensive.  Because he returns from work so late in the night, he is tired and he has no time to prepare dinner. 

Emmanuel has heard from friends that Liquefied Petroleum Gas is cheap but all along he was not able to access it because of the initial costs.  He is thankful for this KIVA loan which supported him in accessing an LPG package.

loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package so that he can prepare healthy food

loans.name: Ephraim

texts.en:
Emphraim is a 32-year-old male who is single.  He works as a sales person at a local warehouse.  Emphraim lives alone and he is looking forward to getting married.  Unfortunately, the room he is renting is too small to accommodate him together with his new family and property he intends to buy.

He is happy that he is looking forward to acquiring modern energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG).  Emphraim is aware that LPG is a clean, reliable form of energy which is also efficient.  Unlike other forms of energy, LPG does not take up most of the space in the house and this will enable us to create enough space in his home.

loans.use: to pay for a package of cooking gas so that he can improve on home energy

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en:
Rogers is a 26-year-old male, and married with a one-year-old child.  He is a business man by profession.  His place of work is about 15km away from home and his wife is not employed, but is instead a housewife. 

Rogers spends a lot on charcoal every day in comparison to cooking gas.  Rogers plans to save money, which he will use to spend on mosquito nets and medical bills.  Cooking gas was always on Rogers' mind but the initial cost for the cylinders, hosepipe, and stove were very high.  With this KIVA loan, Rogers has acquired a package which will save him money.

loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package in order to save on house cooking energy

loans.name: Jabeda

texts.en:
Jabeda is 49 years old and is married to Samser, 60 years old. They live in Dhupguri with their four children. Both of them are illiterate, but can sign their names. Jabeda is a housewife and sometimes works as a daily laborer with an inconsistent income. Her husband has involved himself in farming seasonal vegetables on his own farmland. He sells the vegetables to the local market, but he is unable to earn sufficient income for his family. 

Their children also engaged themselves in agricultural work. Day by day their financial condition is going down, and they are losing their hope for being successful at meeting the family’s basic needs. 

Jabeda wishes to grow potatoes to generate more income. They have their own land and experience in the agricultural field. This is the main reason for choosing this business. She knows that as the potato cultivation is a profitable business, the whole profit will be theirs, and they shall be able to improve their financial condition. 

One fine morning, Jabeda met the field officers of Kiva’s partner, BJS, and came to know about BJS’s activities. She made the decision to take the loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes. She thinks that with the loan money, she will start her potato business, and with the profit from her business she will purchase more farmland to grow more potatoes. 

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for standing beside her to fight against poverty.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes on her own land.

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
Su nombre es juan david, tiene una enfermedad desde los 10 años, vive con la mama, tres hermanos menores de edad, es entusiasta, activo le gusta preguntar cuando algo no le queda claro, le gusta el fútbol, no es una persona conflictiva, es serio con las cosas.
Estudia auxiliar de enfermería porque le gusta ayudar a las personas, y que gracias a la enfermedad conoce sobre las necesidades y el tema de la enfermedad, desde pequeño siempre le ha gustado la enfermería, ayudaba al abuelo con sus medicamentos, y lo ayudaba a inyectarse la insulina, desde ese momento sintió que la enfermería era lo de el, no tiene miedo delas cosas, le gusta que le digan sus errores para a si poder mejorar cada día mas, le gusta salir a colaborar y es muy atento a lo que le dicen.
La mama es la que le paga los semestres, pero necesita este convenio para que el costo del semestre no le quede tan costoso y a la mama le quede un poco mas fácil pagar mientras yo consigo un contrato de aprendizaje para poder pagar también los colegios de los hermanos. 
La meta es seguir con los estudios y ser jefe de enfermería y poder ayudar al que lo necesite.
texts.en:
Juan David has had an illness since he was 10 years old.  He lives with his mother and three siblings who are minors.  He is enthusiastic and active.  He likes to ask when something isn't clear to him.  He likes soccer.  He isn’t a confrontational person and he is serious about things. 

He is studying to be a Nursing Assistant because he likes helping people and thanks to his illness he is familiar with the subject and the hardships of having an illness.  Since childhood he has always liked nursing.  He helped his grandfather with his medications and helped him to inject insulin.  Since that time he felt that nursing was for him.  He isn’t afraid of things.  He likes being told about his mistakes so that he can improve more with each day.  He likes to go to work and he is very attentive to what he is told.

His mother pays for his semesters but he needs this help so that the cost of the semester isn’t so expensive and so that it will be a little bit easier for his mother to pay while he gets an apprenticeship in order to be able to pay the school costs of his siblings as well.  

The goal is to continue with his studies and be head of nursing and to be able to help those who need it.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store and her loan also helped in the education of her children. Her income from the business assisted their everyday expenses at home. She also has a buy and sell business for additional income. 
 
She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Luzviminda dreams to be more successful in business and hopes to buy a lot in Cavite. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Samuth

texts.en:
Samuth is 57 years old. She is married and lives with her four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, all of her children are working in the hotel industry. They make an income of $11 per day to support their family. 

Due to a lack of funds, Samuth has asked for a loan of $1,500 to purchase construction materials to build a room in her house. In addition, a part of this money is to be used to pay for her child’s passport fee. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store to generate more income to stabilize her family’s livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a room in her house.

loans.name: Rubielyn

texts.en:
Rubielyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items like noodles, coffee, sugar and milk to stock and sell in her general store business.  Rubielyn has been in this business for four years.  Rubielyn earns additional income from food vending.

Rubielyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to build and expand her business in order to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like noodles, coffee, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Berlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Berlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business, buying and selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines.   She also earns additional income from raising goats and chickens.  Berlyn is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Berlyn has been sustaining her business activities through the previous eight loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business, buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell.  Gloria has been in this business for eight years.  She also earns additional income from meat vending.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle shop business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase materials for her motorcycle shop.

Amina has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from a general store.

Amina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to  purchase materials for her motorcycle shop.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 54 years old and married with six children.

Veronica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of items like coffee, eggs, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from direct selling beauty products. Veronica has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan.

Veronica aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of items like coffee, eggs, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell like snack foods, noodles, shampoo, sugar, soap, canned goods, and other groceries for her general store business.

Jeniffer has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from selling rice.

Jeniffer has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like snack foods, noodles, shampoo, sugar, soap, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Baby

texts.en:
Baby is 43 years old and is married with two children.

Baby works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, like snack foods, cigarettes, sugar, shampoo, soap and other groceries.

She has previously borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal. Baby aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like snack foods, cigarettes, sugar, shampoo, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes de 32 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo menor de edad. Es Originaria de  león, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera  y se vio en la obligación de trabajar a temprana edad. En la actualidad lucha para brindarle un futuro mejor a su hijo.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de gaseoasas y refrescso en su casa de habitacion. Ella dedica a su negocio unas  8 horas diarias   El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta cajillas y gaseosas y refrescos naturales como pina, calala, granadia, papalla, cacao, banano con leche, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. María Mercedes agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes, 32, is a single mother with a young son. She is originally from León, located in the western part of the country. She is known for being a hard worker and a responsible person with a desire to overcome. Unfortunately, she wasn't able to study a degree and she saw the need to work at an early age. At the present time, she is striving to offer her son a better future.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to come out ahead, as an economic activity she sells soft drinks and drinks out of a room in her house. She works around 8 hours a day. 

The loan will be used to invest in working capital and provide her business with the purchase and sale of soft drinks and natural drinks such as pineapple, passion fruit, papaya, cacao, banana and milk, so that in the near future she can obtain a better income. 

Maria Mercedes is grateful to Kiva lenders for the help they offer to people of limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua, in order to have ways of earning a living with dignity.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to supply her business with soft drinks and natural drinks such as cacao, banana and milk, fruit salad, passion fruit, pineapple, and dragon fruit.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of price fluctuation in her business, but she dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is 28 years old and lives in Tulkarem.  He opened a small garage in 2010 and specializes in repairing vehicles.  This business is the only source of income for his small family. 

Tareq is satisfied with the income but he needs this youth loan to buy an awning and an air pump.  He can’t repair cars when it rains so having an awning  will enable him to service more customers and increase his income.

Tareq is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business.

loans.use: to buy an awning and air pump to repair cars in rainy weather.

loans.name: Isaballa

texts.en:
Isaballa is married and lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a clothing business by selling clothes from her home or door-to-door in her neighborhood. A major challenge for her is a of lack of capital to use to expand her business.

The loan of 50,000 KES will enable Isaballa to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a  mother of four school-aged children. They live in their own house which has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall home-business to sell to her neighbors and customers. She faces a major business challenge of price fluctuation  and she dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a hardworking and enterprising woman who appreciates Kiva for their financial support which has enabled her to earn extra income from her green grocery shop. She used the profits to open a boutique business.

She requests a loan of 100,000 KES to purchase bales of clothing for men, women and children to sell  in her shop.

She thanks Yehu for supporting her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothing for men, women and children to sell in her shop.
